Ḥizb al-wiqāya
حزب الوقاية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
244
Alt. RG №
xml:id
hizb-wiq
Uniform Title
Ḥizb al-wiqāya
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
Allahumma yā ḥayyu yā qayyūm bika taḥassantu
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
994
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A short prayer of protection, widely circulated. Commonly known also as al-Dawr al-aʿlā or Dawr al-aʿlā. OY lists nine separate commentaries, which appear to have been written in 12–13th centuries.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There are many mss., all attributed to IA, though none can be considered historic. The earliest dated copy is 994H. Suha Taji-Farouki, who has produced the critical edition, (see below) is convinced of its authenticity on the basis of textual analyis, and chains of transmission on various mss. Published as Prayer for Spiritual Elevation and Protection (Oxford 2006).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

K. al-Hū
كتاب الهو
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
205
Alt. RG №
xml:id
hu
Uniform Title
K. al-Hū
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Hū wa huwa kitāb al-yā
العنوان الكامل
Variants

Kitâb al-yâ wa Huwa kitâb al-Hû: Kitâb al-yâ

عناوين بديلة
Translations

Book of the Hû

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafā wa-salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna aṣṭafā, rawī ʿan al-nabī…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
761
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
The symbolism of the personal pronoun ‘He’ (huwā), represented, in the order of the alphabet, by the last letter, yāʾ.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 26 mss., of which three are historic. The best are Veliyuddin 51, 762H(c), copied from an original in the hand of IA, and Yusuf Ağa 7838 which is undated, but from SQ’s library so presumed before 673H. According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing and in fact, no place or date is given. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāīl Ibn al–ʿArabī (5/5). Edited by Saʿīd ʿAbd al-Fattāḥ. London: Al-Intishār al-ʿArabī, 2005.

K. al-Ḥujub
كتاب الحجب
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
247
Alt. RG №
xml:id
hujub
Uniform Title
K. al-Ḥujub
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ḥajabnā bihi ʿanhu
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
668
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the veils of the heart which prevent the student from making progress in spiritual realisation.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A commonly copied text, verified by at least five historic mss. The best are Yusuf Ağa 7838, from SQ’s library, Milli 571 and University A4408 dated 748H and checked against an original in IA’s hand. It also appears in good collections such as Carullah 986, Beyazid 3750 and Shehit Ali 1351.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Ifāda li-man arāda al-istifāda
كتاب الإفادة لمن أراد الإستفادة
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
266
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ifada
Uniform Title
K. al-Ifāda li-man arāda al-istifāda
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
"R. al-Ifāda li-man arāda al-istifāda fī ḥaṣr ummahāt al-maʻārif wa-ʻādam ḥaṣr mā yantahī ilayhi al-muwalladāt min al-ʻārif.
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

The Book of Beneficence for Those Who Seek to Benefit: Concerning the Enumeration of the Matrices of Knowledge and the Innumerability of the Subtleties that Issue Therefrom

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
haḍrat ummahāt al-maʿārif
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
664
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the different modes of knowledge.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites seven mss., and the text is verified by one historic ms., Manisa 1183 (664H taken from an original in IA’s hand) which he did not see. OY erroneously lists Fatih 5322 as having an authenticating samāʿ, but this refers to the next work in the collection, K. Maqṣid al-asmāʿ. According to OY, the same work, entitled Ummuhāt al-maʿārif has been attributed to Abd al-Karīm al-Jīlī, and the author mentions the Fuṣūṣ in the text. According to Pablo Beneito, Abū Tālib al-Makkī and Ibn Sīd al-Baṭalyawsī are also mentioned in the text.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Ijāz al-bayān fī tarjama ʿan al-Qurʾān
إجاز البيان في ترجمة عن القرآن
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
268
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ijaz
Uniform Title
Ijāz al-bayān fī tarjama ʿan al-Qurʾān
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hadhā wa-mā kunā li-nahtadī lawlā an hadānā Allāh laqad jaʿat rusul rabbina bi-l-ḥaqq fa-mimmā jaʿat bihi...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
622
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Commentary on the Qurʾan up to verse 253 of sura 2. Text cites K. Abkār al-afkār by Sayf al-dīn al-Āmidī (d. 631H in Damascus).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
We have found two mss, Dügümlü Baba 9 (which has no attribution on it and no date) and Dar al-kutub 1096 tafsīr, which copies IA’s colophon and was copied in 1302H. Abrar Ahmed of the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation in Lahore has found the original copy in IA’s hand in Bayt Jamīl in Baghdad. The title is mentioned in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269), and in FM 3:64. Printed by Ghurab as Raḥma min al-Raḥmān (Damascus, 1979/1401).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Ijāzat al-shaykh al-akbar
إجازة الشيخ الأكبر
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
271
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ijaza-akb

Ijāzat al-shaykh al-akbar
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
Ijāzat-al-shaykh al-akbar li Ṣadr al-dīn al-Qūnawī
العنوان الكامل

عناوين بديلة
Translations

The Spitting of the Heart/Breast (J)

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh ḥaqq ḥamdihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Damascus
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
627-629H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
629
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A list of 44 works which Qūnawī read with IA over a 2-3 year period, signed by him and licensing Qūnawī to transmit the teachings. See the translation of this work by Gerald Elmore, ‘Sadr al-Dīn al-Qûnawī's Personal Study-List of Books by Ibn al-'Arabī’, in Near Eastern Studies, Vol.56, n°7, July 1997, pp. 161-181.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Verified by one definitive historic ms., Yusuf Ağa 7838 in which SQ lists the works that he studied with IA, with dates, followed by certifications in IA’s hand.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar
إجازة للملك المظفر
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
269
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ijaza-muz
Uniform Title
Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
aqūl wa-anā Muḥammad b. ʿAlī b. ʿArabī al-Ḥāṭimī wa-hādhā lafẓī/khaṭṭī
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Damascus
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
627
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<800
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A bibliography written by IA in which he lists 260 (+) of his works and 70 of his teachers. It was written for a sultan, variously known as al-Muẓaffar or al-Muʿaẓẓam Bahāʾ al-Dīn or Shihāb al-Dīn Ghāzī b. al-Malik al-ʿĀdil, in 632H in Damascus.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 16 mss, although none can be considered historic. There are several ‘families’: one is represented by Koprulu 766 (dated by TRF as 632H but we have not been able to find evidence for this); another by Princeton Garrett 4098 (dated 949H) and Zahiriyya 4679 (dated 1305); and the third by Badawi’s edition (and other printed editions). There is also a hybrid, Shehit Ali 2796 (undated), connected to the library of M. b. Qayṣar who was the head of SQ’s zāwiya. The principal factor in verifying this text as by IA is textual, i.e. its correspondence with Fihris muʿallafāt (RG142) and the corpus of known IA works.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

al-Fihrist
الفهرست
Ref
al-Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Ref (OY)
Ref

Other
مصنفات أخرى
References (in this work)
مذكور فيه

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Translations

Studies
Additions
Add Edition par S. 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995, dans le volume qui contient le K. manzil al-manâzil al-fahwâniyya (RG 412), d'après des mss. très tardifs de Dâr al-kutub. S. 'Abd al-Fattâh compare ce texte à celui édité par 'Afîfî (Revue de la Faculté des Lettres de l'Université d'Alexandrie, VIII, 1964) en pensant qu'il s'agit de deux versions d'un même ouvrage alors que le texte édité par 'Afîfî est le Fihris (RG 142) et non l'Ijâza (qui a été édité par 'Abd al-Rahmân Badawî dans Al -Andalus, vol. XX, fasc.1, 1955). (MC)


corrections
additions
Add Edition par S. 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995, dans le volume qui contient le K. manzil al-manâzil al-fahwâniyya (RG 412), d'après des mss. très tardifs de Dâr al-kutub. S. 'Abd al-Fattâh compare ce texte à celui édité par 'Afîfî (Revue de la Faculté des Lettres de l'Université d'Alexandrie, VIII, 1964) en pensant qu'il s'agit de deux versions d'un même ouvrage alors que le texte édité par 'Afîfî est le Fihris (RG 142) et non l'Ijâza (qui a été édité par 'Abd al-Rahmân Badawî dans Al -Andalus, vol. XX, fasc.1, 1955).

K. al-Iʿlām bi-ishārāt ahl al-ilhām
كتاب الإعلام بإشارات أهل الإلهام
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
281
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ilam
Uniform Title
K. al-Iʿlām bi-ishārāt ahl al-ilhām
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
hādhā kitāb al-Iʿlām bi-ishārāt ahl al-ilhām
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Baghdad (?)
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
606 or 613H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
782
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Small work, in the form of 260 sayings of different contemplatives and spiritual travellers. It is divided into seven chapters; the first six on Vision, Hearing, the Word, Union, Knowledge and Love, with the seventh, longer, chapter dealing with a diversity of subjects. According to OY, based upon the Carullah 986 ms., it was composed in Baghdad, but in our reading of the note (see 47b) it is more likely that it was copied or collated there.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 27 mss., of which at least two can be considered as historic: Beyazid 3750 (c.782H) which was copied from IA’s original, and Carullah 286 (undated but early) which carries a note (see 47b) saying that it was copied and collated against a copy which had been read to the author; also Khalidiyya 892 (c.656H)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

K. al-Insān al-kullī
كتاب الإنسان الكلي
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
293
Alt. RG №
802
xml:id
insan
Uniform Title
K. al-Insān al-kullī
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Insān al-kulli fī maʿrifat al-ʿalām al-ʿulwī wa al-suflī
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fataḥa wujūd ʿālam al-takwīn wa-l-tadbīr
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
1057
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on creation of spirits, Pen, Throne, the heavens and ranks of angels. Books mentioned in text are K. al-Nikāḥ (RG 544), K. al-Nafs (RG 521?) and al-Durra al-bayḍāʾ.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites four mss., all of them late. According to him, the preface is identical to ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz (RG802) but the end differs – our preliminary inspection indicates that the beginning is a variant, and it goes up to end of chapter on falak al-kawākib, with an extra piece at the end. Similar in content to Chapter 7 in FM. Needs some further research to determine whether this is really an independent work.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. Inshāʾ al-dawāʾir
كتاب إنشاء الدوائر
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
289
Alt. RG №
xml:id
insha
Uniform Title
K. Inshāʾ al-dawāʾir
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
Al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaqa al-insān ʿalā ṣuratihi wa-khaṣṣaha bi-sarīratihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
655
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
One of Ibn ʿArabī’s most important minor treatises, this work deals with the fundamental premises of his metaphysics; the Divine Essence and Attributes, the human being as the intermediary between Creator and Creation, and the author’s conception of the Universal Reality (al-haqīqa al-kulliya). Built around a pronounced philosophical framework, almost in the kalām style, and copiously illustrated with diagrams and tables. (Fenton and Gloton).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by two historic mss.: Manisa 1183 (655H taken from al-Ḥabashī’s copy), and Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667 and copied by disciple of SQ’s). We know from its mention in al-Tadbīrāt al-Ilāhīya (see Elmore JMIAS 29) that this was one of the first works IA began, but the surviving versions are later, probably written in Tunis in 598/1202 at the home of al-Mahdawī (see FM. Chapter 4).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
References (to this work)
مذكور في
al-Ijāza
الإجازة
Ref
al-Fihrist
الفهرست
Ref
al-Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Ref (OY)
Ref

Other
مصنفات أخرى
References (in this work)
مذكور فيه
Ref

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. ‘Edizione del Kitāb inšā’ al-dawā’ir’. Edited by Maurizio Marconi. El Azufre Rojo 5 (2018).
Translations
تراجم
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. ‘Il libro della produzione dei cerchi di Ibn ʿArabī’. Translated by Maurizio Marconi. El Azufre Rojo 5 (2018).
Studies
أبحاث
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. ‘Il libro della produzione dei cerchi di Ibn ʿArabī’. Translated by Maurizio Marconi. El Azufre Rojo 5 (2018).
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
Y
In Library
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
A critical edition of the Arabic text and a commentary in German was first produced H S Nyberg’s Kleinere Schriften des Ibn al-ʿArabî, (Leiden 1919), pp. 1-38. The Arabic text was reproduced in Fenton and Gloton’s French translation La Productions des cercles (Paris, 1996). Critical edition by Maurizio Marconi in Azufre Rojo vol. 5 (2018). A new critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu, is forthcoming from the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, not yet published.
Translations
English translation by Paul Fenton and Maurice Gloton: ‘The Book of the Description of the Encompassing Circles’ in Muhyiddin Ibn ʿArabī (1165-1240), London, 1993 French translation by Paul Fenton and Maurice Gloton: La Productions des cercles, Paris, 1996. Italian translation by Maurizio Marconi: ‘Il Libro della produzione dei cerchi (kitâb inshâ’i-d-dawâ’ir)’, publication forthcoming (probably 2015).

R. al-Intiṣār
رسالة الإنتصار
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
294
Alt. RG №
xml:id
intisar
Uniform Title
R. al-Intiṣār
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafā wa ʿalā ʿAbd al-Laṭīf b. Aḥmad al-Baghdādī
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
703
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Explanation of several verses by Hallāj and Bisṭāmī. Written in response to Shaykh ʿAbd al-Laṭīf b. Aḥmad b. M al-Baghdādī via Shaykh Abū ʿAbd Allāh M. b. ʿAbd Allāh al-Sharīf al-Fāsī known as Ibn Ṣinhājī (?).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 11 mss., of which none can be considered definitively historic. However, the internal evidence for its authenticity is incontrovertible. The best mss. are Ayasofia 2063 (c.703H), and Shehit Ali 1341 (724H). It also appears in good collections such as Carullah 986 and 2080.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

K. al-Isfār ʿan natāʾij al-asfār
كتاب الإسفار عن نتائج الأسفار
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
307
Alt. RG №
xml:id
isfar
Uniform Title
K. al-Isfār ʿan natāʾij al-asfār
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh al-kāʾin fi-l-ʿamā al-mawṣūf bi-l-istiwāʾ jalāl dhātihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<638
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise explaining the principles of spiritual journeying (to, from and in God), and the inner meanings of various divine and prophetic journeys, such as the descent of the Qurʿān, the ascension of Muhammad, the fall of Adam, and the journeys of Idris/Enoch, Noah, Abraham, Lot, Jacob, Joseph and Moses.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 19 mss., verified by three historic mss. The best is Yusuf Ağa 4859 which is an IA holograph, with a samāʿ, but the ms. has been stolen so only a digitised microfilm is now available (first pages missing). Koprulu 713 contains a copy of this ms., dated 663H in Konya. Critical edition by D. Gril, and new critical edition with translation by Angela Jaffray.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

№ 139 (ʿAwwād 1954)
al-Futūḥāt

مصنفات أخرى

مذكور فيه

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʼil Ibn al-ʿArabī. al-Ṭabʿah 1., الطبعة ١.. Ḥaydarābād al-Dakkan: Maṭbaʿat Dāʼirat al-Maʿārif al-ʿUthmānīyah, 1367.
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʾil Ibn al-ʿArabī (1/3). Edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb. 1. Dimashq: دار نينوى, 2021.
Translations
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
Y
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
A critical edition by Denis Gril was printed alongside his French translation in Le Dévoilement des Effets du Voyage (Paris, 1994). This did not have access to the holograph (Yusuf Ağa 4859). An amended edition, based on the Gril’s work but including Yusuf Ağa 4859, plus a translation into Urdu, has been published by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 2013). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
Translations
English translation by Angla Jaffray: The Secrets of Journeying, Anqa Publishing, Oxford, 2015. French translation by Denis Gril: Le Dévoilement des Effets du Voyage, Paris 1994
Studies
Additions

Critical edition by Souad Hakim. Edition (DG) and trans in progress (AJ)
Editions de l’éclat, 1994, into French by Denis Gril. See P/438
corrections
additions
Add Edition critique du texte arabe et traduction française par D. Gril sous le titre Le Dévoilement des effets du voyage, Editions de l'Eclat, Combas, 1994.

Ishārāt al-Qurʾān fī ʿālam al-insān
إشارات القرآن في عالم الإنسان
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
303
Alt. RG №
xml:id
isharat
Uniform Title
Ishārāt al-Qurʾān fī ʿālam al-insān
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh mursil al-ʿawārif wa-munzil al-laṭāʾif
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Malatya
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
601
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
762
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
In 601H for his friend al-Ḥabashī (see Vel.51/18b).
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Commentary upon the verses of the Qurʾān, conceived as a companion volume to al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya (RG 762). Written for IA’s companion, Badr al-Ḥabashī.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 10 mss., verified by two historic mss., Veliyuddin 51 (c.762H, taken from original in the hand of IA dated 601H) and Yusuf Ağa 7838. According to OY, written 602H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing and in fact, no place is given. The date given is Ramadan 601H, when it is known that IA was in Malatya. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

Related work: tan_maw (762) - nature of relation? Jane anc McAuley’s article: “The Ishârât al-Qur’ân were completed at noon on Wednesday the 13th day of glorious Ramadân in 601. I wrote it out (nasakhtuhu) for my friend al-Mas’ûd ‘Abd Allâh Badr b. ‘Abd Allâh al-Habashî, the freed slave of Abû al-Ghanâîim b. Abî al-Futûh al-Harrân’…”

K. al-Isrā ilā al-maqām al-asrā
كتاب الإسرا إلي المقام الأسرى
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
313
Alt. RG №
xml:id
isra
Uniform Title
K. al-Isrā ilā al-maqām al-asrā
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Isra ila-l-maqām al-asrā
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī salakha niḥārahu min laylihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Fez
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
594H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
633
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Description, in rhyming couplets, of IA’s miʿrāj (spiritual ascension) in Fez, written very soon after the event in 594H.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 30 mss., of which three can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 1628 (read to the author in 633H), which formed the basis of Souad al-Hakim’s critical edition. Ragib Pasha 1453, whilst it is very late, is taken from SQ’s original.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

al-Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣūfiyya
الإصطلاحات الصوفية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
315
Alt. RG №
xml:id
istilahat
Uniform Title
al-Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣūfiyya
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-kafā wa-salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna aṣṭafā wa-ʿalayka ayyuhā al-ḥamīm…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Malatya
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
615H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
637
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise consisting of succinct definitions of 199 commonly used technical Sufi terms. There are three different versions of the text (see below). The first part is based on Qushayrī’s definitions in his Risāla.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least seven historic mss. However, there are three verifiable versions of the original text: version A in Damascus (begins with waqt), without introduction, copied by Ayyūb b. Badr (see Manisa 1183, c. 650H), version B in Konya in a different order (begins with hājis), with an introduction, which was written in Malatya in 615H (see Milli 571, 668H), and version C which was included in the FM (II 128–34; Chapter 173, the response to al-Tirmidhī’s question 153), and consists of version B in reverse order with added questions linking each term.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

مذكور فيه

منشورات

Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʾil Ibn al-ʿArabī (3/3). Edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb. 1. Dimashq: دار نينوى, 2021.

MIAS Records

In Library

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018. Critical Edition in progress by Stephen Hirtenstein.
Translations
English translation by Rabia Terri-Harris:’Sufi Terminology: Ibn ʿArabī’s Al-iṣṭilāh al-ṣūfiyyah’ in JMIAS 3, 1984, pp. 27-54.
Spanish translation by Mohammed Amrani & Alfonso González: Guía Espiritual, Murcia, 1990.
Studies
Additions
Add -Edition, Le Caire, 1357h. -Ed. Le Caire, s.d., par 'Abd al-Rahmân Hasan Mahmûd. -Ed. Beyrouth, 1990 par Bassâm 'Abd al-Wahhâb al-Jabbî -Traduction anglaise par R. Terri Harris, JMIAS, 1984, III, p. 27-54. (MC)
Edition in progress (SH)

Related work (IA): fut_mak (ch. 173, Tirmidhi’s question 153) Related (non-IA) work: Qushayri

R. al-Ittiḥād al-kawnī
رسالة الإتحاد الكوني
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
317
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ittihad
Uniform Title
R. al-Ittiḥād al-kawnī
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

Epistle in which is shown how the creature rediscovers the mnunity to which his essential being bears witness, and how he is brought into the presence of the human tree and the four spiritual birds.

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
hādhā kitāb karīm wa-khiṭāb jasīm...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
>598H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
621
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
A letter was written by IA for Abū l-Fawāris Ṣakhr b. Sinān (Vel.51/48a)
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A poetical work on the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil), the supreme intellect, the guarded tablet, the materia prima, and the universal body. One of IA’s earlier Maghribi works. See Angela Jaffray’s introduction and translation, The Universal Tree and the Four Birds (Oxford, 2005).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 21 mss., of which three are historic mss. The best are Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr in the presence of IA) and Veliyuddin 51 (c. 762H, copied from al-Ḥabashī’s original).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
References (to this work)
مذكور في
al-Ijāza
الإجازة
Ref
№ 67 (Badawī 1955)
al-Fihrist
الفهرست
Ref
№ 63 (ʿAwwād 1954)
al-Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Ref (OY)
Ref

Other
مصنفات أخرى
References (in this work)
مذكور فيه
Ref

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʾil Ibn al-ʿArabī (3/3). Edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb. 1. Dimashq: دار نينوى, 2021.
Translations

MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
Y
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical Edition established by Denis Gril and published alongside his French translation Le Livre de l’Arbre et des Quatre Oisaux (Paris, 1984). This text is also reproduced in Angela Jaffray’s English translation The Universal Tree and the Four Birds (Oxford, 2006). Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
Translations
English translation by Angela Jaffray: The Universal Tree and the Four Birds, Oxford, 2006 Translated into French by Denis Gril: Le Livre de l’Arbre et des Quatre Oisaux, Paris, 1984
Studies
Additions
Add Edition critique et trad. française par D. Gril, sous le titre Le Livre de l'Arbre et des quatre oiseaux, Annales islamologiques, IFAO, Le Caire, XVII, 1981. La traduction française seule a été rééditée sous le même titre, Edition Les Deux Océans, Paris, 1984. (MC)
Edition by DG and translation by AJ forthcoming.

corrections
additions
Add Edition critique et trad. française par D. Gril, sous le titre Le Livre de l'Arbre et des quatre oiseaux, Annales islamologiques, IFAO, Le Caire, XVII, 1981. La traduction française seule a été rééditée sous le même titre, Edition Les Deux Océans, Paris, 1984.

Shehit Ali, 2813, 26-33b, read before IA, carries a sema¡

Vel 50: Ibn ‘Arabî… wrote it to Abû l-Fawâris Sakhr b. Sinân (owner of the reins of generosity and eloquence) may God grant both of them success. [It is] the transmission of the Sufi … Badr … al-Habashî, freed slave of Abû l-Ghanâ’im Ibn Abî l-Futûh al-Harrânî …

K. al-Jalāl wa-l-jamāl
كتاب الجلال والجمال
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
168
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jalal
Uniform Title
K. al-Jalāl wa-l-jamāl
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh al-ʿaẓīm jalāluhu al-mahbūb (li-ẓuhūr) jamāluhu al-baʿīd fī dunūhi al-qarīb fī sumūhi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mosul
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
601
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<615
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Composed in one day in 601H in Mosul (see Veliyuddin 1826, 52b)
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Reflections on the meaning of Majesty and Beauty, as opposing aspects, and how they relate to intimacy and awe on the human side, with a discussion of Qurʾanic verses in the light of the two divine principles, alluding to the third aspect which integrates them, the balance of perfection. Written in one day in 601H in Mosul.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites 20 mss., of which the earliest is the undated holograph extract (Yusuf Aga 4868). Berlin spr 783 was copied in IA’s lifetime (pm 185 was listed by OY as an SQ autograph, which it is not). There are several dated from the 8th century.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

الفتوحات

Ref

K. al-Jalāla
كتاب الجلالة
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
169
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jalala
Uniform Title
K. al-Jalāla
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh ḥamdan lā taʿalamahu al-asrār…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Jerusalem
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
601
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
615
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Secrets and the spiritual power contained in the letters of the name ‘Allāh’.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by seven historic mss. The best is a holograph, Yusuf Aga 4868 (ms. stolen, so copy digitised from microfilm). Yusuf Aga 7838 was probably written in IA’s lifetime, and Milli A571, dated 668H, was copied and checked against IA’s copy. Carullah 2111 was copied from a holograph dated 628H and collated with an autograph dated 637H. According to OY, composed in 601H in Jerusalem.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

Denis and Jane dispute this dating:

Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-durra al-bayḍāʾ
جواب عن مسألة الدرة البيضاء
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
178
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jawab-dur
Uniform Title
Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-durra al-bayḍāʾ
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
iʿlam an Allāhu subḥānahu wa-taʿālā huwa al-mawjūd al-muṭlaq lā ʿan ʿadam
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the relationship between Being, non-existence and the possible, with a discussion of the various terms for the First Intellect.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Two mss. cited by OY, including Veliyuddin 1821 which our inspection shows to be unattributed to IA. In its current form it is unlikely to be by IA as in FM he does not use the term al-mawjūd al-muṭlaq, only al-wujūd al-muṭlaq (eg FM 1:44, 76, 365, 718 etc ), and the phrase al-durra al-bayḍāʾ occurs only twice (FM 1:46, 2:30) (SH). Further work needed.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Jawāb al-mustaqīm ʿammā saʾal ʿanhu al-Tirmidhī al-Ḥakīm
كتاب الجواب المستقيم عما سأل عنه الترمذي الحكيم
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
177
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jawab-mus
Uniform Title
K. al-Jawāb al-mustaqīm ʿammā saʾal ʿanhu al-Tirmidhī al-Ḥakīm
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Jawāb al-mustaqim ʿanmā saʾala ʿanhu al-Tirmidhī al-ḥakīm
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
saʾalt ayuhā al-akh al-waliyy al-ḥamīm an ashraḥ laka al-masāʾil al-rūhāniyya
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
603
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
617?
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A response to various questions about mystical and esoteric matters posed by al-Tirmidhī (d. 285/898) in his famous work, Khatm al-awliyāʾ (Seal of the Saints). It consists of 55 questions and answers. A similar section is included in FM 2:39-139, but according to Michel Chodkiewicz it is not identical to this work.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 11 mss., the best being Veliyuddin 1759, which is a holograph, undated but necessarily before 638H. OY dates the composition as 603H based on a note on Beyazit 3750 (253b), but we could not find any indication of this; it looks as if there has been confusion with another work in the same collection.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
References (to this work)

al-Ijāza
الإجازة

al-Fihrist
الفهرست
Ref
al-Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Ref (OY)
Ref

Other
مصنفات أخرى
References (in this work)
مذكور فيه
Ref

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʾil Ibn al-ʿArabī (2/3). Edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb. 1. Dimashq: دار نينوى, 2021.
Translations
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
n
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Translations

Studies
Additions
Add A titre d'informations complémentaires je signale que le fameux questionnaire de Tirmidhî a suscité d'autres réponses: -Qurrat-al-'ayn fî l-jawâb 'an al-as'ila al-muwadda'a fî khabi'at al-kawn; (inédit sauf erreur); ouvrage du shaykh Ahmad al-'Ayyâshî Sukayraj al-Ansârî, shaykh tijânî mort en 1944. -Al-jawâb al-shafî 'alâ as'ilat al-Hakîm al-Tirmidhî, (Le Caire, 1987) dont l'auteur, Muhammad 'Alî Salâma identifie le khatm muhammadî avec le shaykh égyptien Abû l-'Azâ'im, mort en 1938. Je n'ai pu lire le premier de ces deux ouvrages; le second est d'une décevante platitude. Corr Contrairement à ce qu'indiquait O. Y. cet ouvrage n'est pas "inclus dans les Futûhât ", ainsi que l'a d'ailleurs montré O.Y. lui-même par la suite dans son édition du Khatm al-awliyâ' de Tirmidhî, Beyrouth 1965. Il publie en effet en notes (pp. 142 à 326) les réponses au questionnaire de Tirmidhî qui figurent dans le Jawâb mustaqîm et celles, beaucoup plus longues et très différentes dans leur contenu, qui se trouvent dans le chapitre 73 des Futûhât. Les deux textes ont le même objet mais ne peuvent en aucune façon être considérés comme identiques. (MC)


corrections
additions
msAdditions
veliyuddin 1759, 62-78b, autograph, but the beginning is missing

Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-sabaja al-sawdāʾ
جواب عن مسألة السبجة السوداء
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
179
Alt. RG №
434
xml:id
jawab-sab
Uniform Title
Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-sabaja al-sawdāʾ
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
Jawāb ʿan masʾalāt al-sabaja al-sawdāʾ wa-hiya al-hayūlā.
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
>950
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the nature of the materia prima, time, and the celestial spheres in terms reminiscent of IA’s teachings. According to Claude Addas, likely to be authentic and part of three short treatises, which have been edited by Abd al-Baqi Miftah.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only two mss. mentioned by OY (see p. 269), neither of them with good provenance. Berlin 2960 is very late, and there is nothing on the work to indicate that it is by IA, except that it is part of collection of works, by IA and other Sufi authors. We have not managed to inspect the other, Ismail Saïb 1197. Also mss at Cairo Khedivial 6/90 (16368), Dar al-Kutub 1/246 (46) and Vienna, Kaiser 1910/3 and Mecca Haram 3939.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Jawāb suʾāl Ibn Sawdakīn
جواب سؤال ابن سودكين
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
182
Alt. RG №
xml:id
jawab-sawd
Uniform Title
Jawāb suʾāl Ibn Sawdakīn
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
Jawāb suʾāl Ibn Sawdakîn ʿan a’lā al-marātib wa-l aḥwāl:
العنوان الكامل
Variants

K. al-’iqd al-manzûm; Al-ajwiba ‘alâ masâ’il Ibn Sawdakîn ‘an a’lâ al-marâtib wa-l ahwâl; R. fî su’al Ibn Sawdakîn.

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
lammā kāna kull shayʾ fī al-imkān ṣādiran ʿan wājib al-wujūd...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Aleppo?
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<638
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Response to a question on the highest degree of spiritual states which can be reached by the people of God, by Ibn Sawdakīn (d.646/1248) reporting from Ibn ‘Arabi.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Seven mss. cited by OY, verified by two historic ones. The best is Yusuf Aga 4868, which was copied during IA’s lifetime.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Jawāb ʿan masʾalat al-zumurruda al-khaḍrāʾ
العنوان الموحد

Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
Jawāb ʿan masʾalāt al-zumurruda al-khaḍrāʾ
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
1202
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the universal soul.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A work called K. al-nafs wa-huwa k. al-Zumurruda al-khaḍrāʾ is mentioned in ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz. It is also part of RG 434. OY lists only two mss. for this work. Berlin 3001 is very late, and there is nothing on the work to indicate that it is by IA. We have not managed to inspect the other, Ismail Saïb 1197. ‘Abd al-Baqi Miftah has edited this, and Claude Addas believes it to be authentic.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. Kashf al-maʿnā
كتاب كشف المعنى
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
338
Alt. RG №
xml:id
kashf
Uniform Title
K. Kashf al-maʿnā
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. Kashf al-maʿnā ʿan sirr asmāʾ Allāh al-ḥusnā
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

The Secret of the Names of God

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
qāla Allāh taʿālā wa-lillāh al-asmāʾ al-ḥusnā fa-adʿūhu bihā
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Damascus
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
621H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
783
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Commentaries on the 99 Divine Names of God. After a brief introduction in which the traditional theological categories of the Names are laid out, the 99 Names of God (as in al-Ghazālī’s listing) are treated according to three concepts (first proposed by Abū Madyan): taʿalluq (dependence); taḥaqquq (realisation); and takhalluq (assimilation). Critical edition and Spanish translation by P. Beneito.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 22 mss., although none can be considered truly historic. However, the evidence is compelling: Ulu Cami 1581 (c.826H) may have been copied from an original, as it carries a note by IA about the composition of the work, that it was written in Ramaḍān 621H for a known disciple, Sharafuddīn Abū Muḥammad ʿAbd al-Wāḥid b. Abū Bakr b. Sulaymān al-Ḥamawī. The earliest copy is Fatih 5298, dated 783H, which also has a colophon saying that it is a work by IA and that it was dictated to a student in 621H in Damascus. A work of this title is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza l-il-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269), and there is a correspondence with other works on the Divine Names (see FM 559).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
Y
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical Edition published by Pablo Beneito and published alongside his Spanish translation El secreto de los nombres de Dios (Murcia, 1996). This text is also reproduced alongside the French translation Les Secret des Noms de Dieu (Paris, 2010). A newer edition, alongside an Urdu translation, published by The Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2014). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, (with Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī) (Cairo 2016) based on mss. from the MIAS archive.
Translations
English translation by Stephen Hirtenstein and Pablo Beneito: The Secret of the Names of God, Anqa Publishing, forthcoming. Spanish translation by Pablo Beneito: El secreto de los nombres de Dios, Murcia, 1996. French translation by Pablo Beneito: Les Secret des Noms de Dieu, Paris, 2010. Italian translation by Pablo Beneito, I Nomi più belli di Dio, Milano, 2011
Italian translation by Pablo Beneito, Alberto De Luca: Il segreto dei 99 nomi di Dio : il capitolo 558 delle Futûhât al-Makkiyya, Rome, 2007.
Studies
Additions

Critical edition and Spanish transaltion by PB and SH, El secreto de los nombres de Dios (Murcia, 1996). English trans in progress (CT)
Murcia, 1996, into spanish by Pablo Benito. See P/435

al-Kawkab al-durrī fī manāqib Dhī al-Nūn al-Miṣrī
الكوكب الدري في مناقب ذي النون المصري
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
347.1
Alt. RG №
xml:id
kawkab
Uniform Title
al-Kawkab al-durrī fī manāqib Dhī al-Nūn al-Miṣrī
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hayyama qulūb al-ʿārifīn fī awdiyat maḥabbatihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
712
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Stories of Dhū al-Nūn (d. 180/796), the famous early Egyptian Sufi master, recorded by IA from various companions. Written after the death of Yūnus b. Yaḥyā (d. 608H), who is referred to as no longer alive, and perhaps composed in Cairo where Dhū al-Nūn is buried.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Not listed in OY, and only one ms. in the Topkapi library is extant. Its acceptance as a verified text by IA comes from the internal evidence of the people cited in the text (Stephen Hirtenstein). There are two printed Arabic editions; one by ʿAbd al-Fattāh in Rasāʾil (Vol 3) and one by Ibrahīm al-Kayyālī (Beirut 2005).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

K. al-Khalwa
كتاب الخلوة
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
255
Alt. RG №
xml:id
khalwah
Uniform Title
K. al-Khalwa
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī alhama al-ṣafwa min ʿibādihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<668
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
On retreat in general, but mentioning some particular kinds of retreat at end, e.g. the hoopoe retreat. Written for Abū al-ʿAbbās Aḥmad b. ʿAlī b. Maymūn b. Ab al-Tawzarī (see Chapter 69 of FM (1:91)).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work under various titles, verified by three historic mss. The earliest is either Koprulu 766 (pre-638?) or Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667). Sometimes confused with R. al-Anwār (RG 33). Mentioned in both FM and Maqām al-qurba.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

R. al-Khirqa
رسالة الخرقة
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
530
Alt. RG №
xml:id
khirqa
Uniform Title
R. al-Khirqa
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī khalaʿa ʿalā ʿibādihi ahli al-ʿināyatihi asmāʾahu al-husnā
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Damascus
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
633
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
999
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A late work, it gives a detailed list of ‘investitures’ through which the Shaykh received initiation into the Path, including one by the hidden guide, al-Khiḍr.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 19 mss., of which one can be considered historic: Esad Ef. 1507 (999H, copied from an original dated 633H in IA’s handwriting and corrected by him). Many mss. are incomplete. Veliyuddin 51 contains only the 599H khirqa, but it is also copied from an original in the hand of IA. Further mss: Bankipore ms 955/2 (778H?)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

AP

Alternate title: Nasab al-Khirqa Dating: 599H khirqa seems to already have been written in 601/602H (see Veliyuddin 51), though not as a complete work... written over a period?

K. Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minhu
كتاب كنه ما لا بد للمريد منه
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
352
Alt. RG №
xml:id
kunh
Uniform Title
K. Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minhu
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabb al-ʿalamīn wa-ʿāqibuhu lil-muttaqīn wa-ṣallā Allāh ʿalā sayyidinā Muḥammad
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mosul
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
601H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
724
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Advice to the student starting out on the Sufi path.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work (OY lists 35 mss.), verified by three historic mss. The best are Shehit Ali 1341 (724H taken from an original in the hand of IA), Manisa 1183 (650H, written by a direct student of IA’s), and Veliyuddin 51 (762H and copied from IA’s original). According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.) Further mss identified by JC: Bankipore ms 955/1 (778H), said to be transcribed from autograph; KÖPRÜLÜ Fazıl Ahmed Pş 53, ff. 109-163
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Translations
English translation by Tosun Bayrak al-Jerrahi: ‘What the Student Needs: Ibn ʿArabī’s Ma la budda minhu lil-murid’ in JMIAS 5, 1986, pp. 28-55. English Translation by Tosun Bayrak and Rabia Terri Harris: What the Seeker Needs, USA, 1993 English translation by Shaykh Tosun Bayrak: Divine Governance of the Human Kingdom, plus ‘What the seeker needs’ and ‘Treatise on Unity’, Louisville, 1997. English translation by James Morris in his paper From ethics and devotion to spiritual realisation : Ibn ‘Arabî on what is indispensable for the spiritual seeker, Kuala Lumpur : Centre for Civilisational Dialogue, University of Malaysia, 2007, 32 p. Italian translation by Placido Fontanesi, Il libro di ciò che è essenziale riguardo a quanto è indispensabile per l’aspirante, Rivista di studi tradizionali, 1982, pp. 7-22
Spanish translation by Mohammed Amrani & Alfonso González: Guía Espiritual, Murcia, 1990 Spanish translation by Tosun Bayrak al-Jerrahi al-Halveti, Afife Traverso and Emilio Alzueta: El divino gobierno del reino humano, Lo que necesita el buscador tratador sobre el uno y único, Granada, 2004.
Studies
Additions
Add. Edition Le Caire, 1387/1967, et 1987 Traduction anglaise par Arthur Jeffery (Instructions for a postulant) dans A Readear on Islam , Londres, 1962, pp. 640-655. (MC)
Forthcoming translation by Jim Morris in JMIAS. Tosun Bayrak’s version is not the same as Morris’s, as it comes from a later edition in Turkish rather than the original Arabic.
Partial translation by Asin Palacios in El Islam christianizado pp371-377. Edition Madrid, 1931

additions
Add. Edition Le Caire, 1387/1967, et 1987 Traduction anglaise par Arthur Jeffery (Instructions for a postulant) dans A Readear on Islam , Londres, 1962, pp. 640-655.

Dating Denis and Jane: “Osman Yahia maintains that the work was composed in Mosul in 601, and he gives as his source not Veliyuddin 51 but a reference in Brockelmann, who lists other manuscripts, outside Turkey, which we have not yet inspected.” This could make sense given qas_ilah was composed in Mosul on this date in the same collection...

R. al-Kutub
رسالة الكتب
Title & Identification

kutub

Full Title
Al-anfâs al-‘uluwiyya fi-l-mukâtabât; al-mukâtabât
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
salām ʿalā waliyyi fi-llāh taʿālā Abū al-Qāsim al-ʿImād b. al-Sakkarī
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<700
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A series of letters from the author to different people, some containing poems.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss., none of which are definitively historic. Internal evidence for attribution (e.g. mention of Seville, al-Muḥāsibī, al-Shakkāz in Granada, Ibn Saydabūn) is compelling, however. There is a lot of variation in the number of letters, with Fatih 5322 giving 43 in total, Carullah 986 22 and Carullah 2080 only 13. Further mss identified by JC: Uppsala 162/15 (ff.77b-82a)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. Lawāqiḥ al-asrār
كتاب لواقح الأسرار
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
368.1
Alt. RG №
xml:id
lawaqih
Uniform Title
K. Lawāqiḥ al-asrār
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
samʿatu sayyidī Muhyī al-Dīn yaqūl wa-kunā fī khalwa
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A record of the discussions on various topics which Ibn Sawdakīn (d. 646) had with his master Ibn ʿArabī. The content includes that of K. al-Wasāʾil by Ibn Sawdakīn (RG 436), which is really an extract of this longer work.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY states that there are no extant mss of this work, but three copies have now been found: the earliest is Zahiriyya 16632, which is in the hand of al-Farghānī, probably dateable to 660s. There are also much later less reliable copies in the Budeiri library, 142, and in the Dar al-Kutub, Cairo, Taymur 147. Further mss identified by JC: Damascus al-Assad (http://www.alassad-library.gov.sy/Search_makhtotat2013.php): 16627/2 which follows IA’s ʿAqīda, dated 955.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

corrections
additions
Corr La brève notice d'O.Y. est ambigüe. Ce titre, comme le confirme Sha'rânî (Al-yawâqit wa l-jawâhir, Le Caire, 1369h., II, p. 182) est celui d'un recueil dans lequel Ibn Sawdakîn a rassemblé des propos d'Ibn Arabî.

People: Ibn Sawdakīn - compiler and author (?) <persName role="com" key="person_0000">Ibn Sawdakīn</persName> <author cert="high" key="person_0000">Ibn Sawdakīn</author> Related item: K. al-Wasāʾil by Ibn Sawdakīn (RG 436) is an extract of K. Lawāqiḥ al-asrār (368.1)

Madkhal fī ʿilm al-ḥurūf
مدخل في علم الحروف
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
384
Alt. RG №
xml:id
madkhal-hur
Uniform Title
Madkhal fī ʿilm al-ḥurūf
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh al-mulhim asrāruhu wa-muṭliʿ shumūs ʿilmihi...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
725
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the science of letters, a relatively simple work of letter correspondences.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss: he considers it a resumé of RG 297, ʿIqd al-manẓūm , and the mss. are classified in a very confusing way between the two RGs. A quick check of all the mss. shows that they are fundamentally the same work, with some variations. We therefore suggest reclassifying all of them under RG 384. There are no definitive historic mss., although Shehit Ali 1341 is early. OY has Veliyudin 51 as copied from an original, but in our opinion the note refers to the previous work (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley in JMIAS 36). Nevertheless, the work appears in many early collections and there is a good case for its authenticity.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

JC

JC

AK

MM

AP

Related Item: RG 297 (OY duplicate) Denis and Jane (Vel.51): . Osman Yahia calls it K. ‘Iqd al-manzûm and assigns to it RG 297 along with eight other manuscripts. However, he also assigns RG 384, Madkhal fî’ilm al-hurûf to four of these. This has led to a very confusing situation which requires another article to satisfactorily resolve.[27] The question of the status of the work in Veliyuddin 51, however, can be addressed. Although it has no specific notes attached to it, it may well be covered by the general note on 84a, in which case it would have been copied from an original autograph. On the other hand, it is at the end of the collection and the following work, Istilâhât al-sûfiyya, although it has a note with a copying date (see below), again makes no mention of having been taken from an autograph. In view of the consistent notes throughout the rest of the collection, it may be that these last two works were added slightly later from other sources, and so were not covered by the note on 84a. None of the other manuscripts have a provenance which would definitively establish ‘Iqd al-manzûm as an Ibn ‘Arabî work, and Veliyuddin 51 has therefore been cited as the best source. But on the basis of what we have said above, the evidence is not sufficient to prove authenticity beyond doubt.

Ibn al-ʿArabī also mentions K. al-Ḥurūf in K. al-Alif and K. al-Mīm. Is this definitely a different work?

K. Mafātiḥ al-ghuyūb
كتاب مفاتح الغيوب

الكلمة الافتتاحية

نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the ‘keys’ that allow one to enter the unseen world. See also FM 1:173.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 28 mss., and at least two can be considered definitely historic. The best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr and checked by IA) and Private 1 (c. 637H, written by a close disciple).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Maḥajja al-bayḍāʾ
كتاب المحجة البيضاء
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
392
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mahajja
Uniform Title
K. al-Maḥajja al-bayḍāʾ
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Maḥajjat al-baiḍā Fi-l- aḥkām al-sharʿiyya
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mecca
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
600
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A work on Islamic law (fiqh). In Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142), IA says that he composed this work in Mecca in three parts: the first on ritual purity, the second and third on the prayer itself. There is just one extant copy, which is the second part of the work.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Verified by one historic ms., Yusuf Ağa 4986, an autograph dated 600H which was part of SQ’s library. Original ms. was stolen, so we only have a digital copy of a photocopy. According to information in Konya, the book was gifted to SQ’s mother as a wedding gift by IA.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

R. al-Maʿlūm min ʿaqāʾid ʿulamāʾ al-rusūm
رسالة المعلوم من عقائد علماء الرسوم
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
402
Alt. RG №
xml:id
malum
Uniform Title
R. al-Maʿlūm min ʿaqāʾid ʿulamāʾ al-rusūm
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
ajtamaʿa arbaʿat nafar min al-ʿulamā fī qubbat Arīn
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Damascus
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
602
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
762
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Damascus on 3 Jumādā 602H (Vel.51/114a)
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on four kinds of knowers (ʿulamāʾ) at the Well of Arīn (axis mundi): those of the west (maghrib), those of the east (mashriq), those of the north (shimāl) and those of the south (yamīn), and their kinds of knowledge. See also FM 1:38-41.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites seven mss. Verified by one historic ms.,Veliyuddin 51 (762H, copied from an original composed in Damascus in 602H). Milli 2988 is the same text, but the other two mss. we have consulted are different texts. Confused with RG 34 and others. Further work needed. Further mss identified by JC: Tunis, Dar al-Kutub al-Wataniya 641, and Escurial ms 417 / 4 (f. 117-131?)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Jane and Denis (vel.51): At the end, on 114a, there is a note saying that it was composed in Damascus on 3rd Jumâdâ al-ûlâ of the year 602

K. Manzil al-manāzil
كتاب منزل المنازل
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
412
Alt. RG №
xml:id
manzil
Uniform Title
K. Manzil al-manāzil
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. Manzil al-manāzil al-fahwāniyya
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nafakha al-ʿuqūl bi-ʿulūm al-riyāḍāt
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
603H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
618
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
An intricate treatise describing an elaborate hierarchy of ‘way-stations’ or ‘abodes’ (see Michel Chodkiewicz, Ocean, 64–67). There are 19 major manāzil, corresponding to 19 classes of Qur’anic suras, many of which are sub-divided. The work is also known as Kitāb al-fahwāniyya, a technical term designating the Divine Speech addressing the servant face to face in the presence of imagination. Here, it denotes the comprehensive way-station of basmala, which has 19 letters. The treatise ends with an account of the mystical ascent (mirʿāj). See FM I:171-180.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 10 mss., with one very good historic ms. verifying the work: the holograph Veliyuddin 1759 (618H) with a samāʿ written by Ibn Sawakīn in Aleppo. It also appears in other good collections, particularly Beyazid 3750 and Carullah 986. OY dates the composition to 603H based on a note at the end of Beyazit 3750 (432a), but we could not verify this; it is possible that there is some confusion with a note on another work.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة
References (to this work)
مذكور في
al-Ijāza
الإجازة
Ref
№ 106 (Badawī 1955)
al-Fihrist
الفهرست
Ref
№ 99 (ʿAwwād 1954)
al-Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Ref (OY)
Futuhat Chapter 22
Ref

Other
مصنفات أخرى

مذكور فيه

Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāīl Ibn al–ʿArabī (1/5). Edited by Saʿīd ʿAbd al-Fattāḥ. London: Al-Intishār al-ʿArabī, 2001.

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
Translations

Studies
Additions
Add Edition par Sa'îd 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995 (précédé de RG. 269 et suivi de RG. 46). Cette édition est exclusivement basée sur le ms. autographe Veliyuddin 1759 dont l'écriture maghrébine est peu familière à l'éditeur.On y repère certaines erreurs de lecture que signale en général une incorrection grammaticale. Elle est néanmoins très utile mais sa courte introduction est décevante. La notion de fahwâniyya-la "Parole face-à-face" dans le 'âlam al-khayâl-qui apparaît souvent dans les écrits d'Ibn Arabî (Futûhât, Tajalliyât, K. al-'abâdila...) est correctement expliquée par la définition qui se trouve dans Fut., II, p. 128 (question 152, définition n°8) et dans les Istilâhât al-sûfiyya (déf. 192). mais il aurait été souhaitable de signaler qu'elle a chez Ibn Arabî, dans l'emploi du 'ilm al-hurûf, une conséquence importante : à la différence du mode de calcul normal elle oblige à prendre en considération les valeurs numériques des lettres effectivement prononcées (et non pas seulemnt de celles qui sont écrites). C'est pourquoi, par exemple, le nom al-rahmân (=330) a une valeur de 530 dans la hadra fahwaniyya (Fut. I, 185), la lettre râ (=200) y étant comptée deux fois. De même le nom Muhammad (MHMD) dont la somme des lettres est de 92 a, dans la hadra fahwâniyya, la valeur 132 qui correspond à MHMMD. L'éditeur ne semble pas d'autre part avoir vu que, dans cet ouvrage, comme dans le chapitre 22 et dans le fasl al-manâzil des Futûhât, le terme manzil renvoie toujours au Coran et désigne, soit une sourate ou un groupe de sourates, soit un verset, un mot ou une lettre du Livre. C'est cette hiérarchie de significations que l'on doit avoir en vue pour comprendre ce texte apparemment cryptique. Ibn Arabî en donne d'ailleurs lui-même la clef lorsqu'il énumère (p. 113) les 19 catégories de sourates. Il est donc facile de saisir que, par exemple, le manzil al-thanâ' regroupe les cinq sourates qui commencent par al-hamdu li-Llâh, le manzil al-rumûz celles qui commencent par les hurûf nûrâniyya, le manzil al-nidâ celles qui commencent par yâ ayyuhâ etc. Quand Ibn Arabî indique qu'entre tel manzil et tel autre il y a x manâzil, ce nombre est celui des sourates intermédiaires. (Sur le problème des manâzil voir M. Chodkiewicz, Un Océan sans rivage, pp. 87-98; trad anglaise, An Ocean without shore, pp. 64-74. (MC)


corrections
additions
Add Edition par Sa'îd 'Abd al-Fattâh, Le Caire, 1995 (précédé de RG. 269 et suivi de RG. 46). Cette édition est exclusivement basée sur le ms. autographe Veliyuddin 1759 dont l'écriture maghrébine est peu familière à l'éditeur.On y repère certaines erreurs de lecture que signale en général une incorrection grammaticale. Elle est néanmoins très utile mais sa courte introduction est décevante. La notion de fahwâniyya-la "Parole face-à-face" dans le 'âlam al-khayâl-qui apparaît souvent dans les écrits d'Ibn Arabî (Futûhât, Tajalliyât, K. al-'abâdila...) est correctement expliquée par la définition qui se trouve dans Fut., II, p. 128 (question 152, définition n°8) et dans les Istilâhât al-sûfiyya (déf. 192). mais il aurait été souhaitable de signaler qu'elle a chez Ibn Arabî, dans l'emploi du 'ilm al-hurûf, une conséquence importante : à la différence du mode de calcul normal elle oblige à prendre en considération les valeurs numériques des lettres effectivement prononcées (et non pas seulemnt de celles qui sont écrites). C'est pourquoi, par exemple, le nom al-rahmân (=330) a une valeur de 530 dans la hadra fahwaniyya (Fut. I, 185), la lettre râ (=200) y étant comptée deux fois. De même le nom Muhammad (MHMD) dont la somme des lettres est de 92 a, dans la hadra fahwâniyya, la valeur 132 qui correspond à MHMMD. L'éditeur ne semble pas d'autre part avoir vu que, dans cet ouvrage, comme dans le chapitre 22 et dans le fasl al-manâzil des Futûhât, le terme manzil renvoie toujours au Coran et désigne, soit une sourate ou un groupe de sourates, soit un verset, un mot ou une lettre du Livre. C'est cette hiérarchie de significations que l'on doit avoir en vue pour comprendre ce texte apparemment cryptique. Ibn Arabî en donne d'ailleurs lui-même la clef lorsqu'il énumère (p. 113) les 19 catégories de sourates. Il est donc facile de saisir que, par exemple, le manzil al-thanâ' regroupe les cinq sourates qui commencent par al-hamdu li-Llâh, le manzil al-rumûz celles qui commencent par les hurûf nûrâniyya, le manzil al-nidâ celles qui commencent par yâ ayyuhâ etc. Quand Ibn Arabî indique qu'entre tel manzil et tel autre il y a x manâzil, ce nombre est celui des sourates intermédiaires. (Sur le problème des manâzil voir M. Chodkiewicz, Un Océan sans rivage, pp. 87-98; trad anglaise, An Ocean without shore, pp. 64-74.
msAdditions

نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
OY: Treatise on the Divine Proximity and the ways of entering it.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by two good historic ms. The best is Veliyuddin 1759 (holograph with samāʿ dated 617H in Aleppo and 633H in Damascus). Also KÖPRÜLÜ Fazıl Ahmed Pş 53, ff. 152-155

Maqṣid al-asmāʾ

العنوان الموحد
Full Title
Al-Maqsid al-asrār fī ishārāt fī mā waqaʿa fi al-Qurʾān bi lisān al-ḥaqīqa wa al-sharīʿa min al-kināyāt
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

The highest calling through the allusion of names and pronouns manifested by the Qur⁄ån in the language of the essential Reality and the law.

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-huwa nafsu al-ḥamd ʿalā mā taqarrara fī qalb

Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Short work on the inner meaning of Names and Attributes mentioned in the Fātiḥa.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 24 mss., of which seven can be considered historic. The best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr in the presence of IA and verified).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Additions, Comments and Corrections

Editions
Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018. A critical edition has been prepared by Denis Gril, but it is not yet unpublished. Claude Addas writes: Cet ouvrage a été édité par Sa'îd 'Abd al-Fattâh in Rasâ'il Ibn Arabî, vol .1,Beyrouth, 2001,pp. 247-261 sur la base du ms. veliyuddin 1826. Egalement édité par \'Asim IBrâhîm al-Kiyâlî, Beyrouth, 2004, dans un volume intitulé al-shajarât al-nu\'mâniyya et contenant plusieurs traités d\'I.A authentiques ou apocryphesz selon les cas.

There is a study by Denis Gril, and a critical edition in progress.

Alternate title: Al-madkhal ilâ ma’rifa ma’âkhidh al-nazar fî al-asmâ’

K. Marātib ʿulūm al-wahb
كتاب مراتب علوم الوهب
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
423
Alt. RG №
xml:id
maratib

K. Marātib ʿulūm al-wahb
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh munaffikh al-fuhūm wa-fātiḥ maghāliq al-ʿulūm ʿan sirr al-maktūm
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
823
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the kinds of knowledge which are given by divine grace. See FM I:57-172; 3:501-505; 4:37-38. A catalogue entry for Escurial 1607/17 (f.82) notes that the work was composed in 602H. It seems the source for this info was Brockelmann Ar. Litt. I 444.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 26 mss., verified by two good historic mss., Veliyuddin 1826 (c.823H, copied from an original in the hand of IA) and Carullah 986 (nd., checked against copy read to author). There are four other good mss., although none of them are definitive. There is a note at the end of Beyazit 3750 (151b) saying that the work is a selection from a manzil from FM (muqaddar min hādhā l-manzil min al-Futūḥāt al-Makkiyya). OY states that it was composed in Baghdad on the basis of a note on Carullah 986; however, this actually says that it was checked against a copy read in Baghdad.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

R. fī Maʿrifat laylat al-qadr

Ibn ¡Arabj

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
thumma innī li-mā qayyadtu hādhihi al-ʿujāla aṭlaʿanī al-ḥaqq subḥānihi fī bʿaḍ al-waqāʾiʿ al-sharīfa
الكلمة الافتتاحية

نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A short work on the timing of the Night of Power, and the exact moment of its appearance.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
No definitive historic mss. but two of the three surviving texts are early. The case rests on Yusuf Ağa 4883, whose provenance is still to be determined, and correlation with relevant sections of FM. The text is published with an English translation by Beneito and Hirtenstein in JMIAS 27, pp. 1-20.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Maʿrifa
كتاب المعرفة الأولى
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
433
Alt. RG №
xml:id
marifa-ula
Uniform Title
K. al-Maʿrifa
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-maʿrifa
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wāhib al-asrār li-l-arbāb
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<658
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A gathering of metaphysical and theological questions presented in an analytical and doctrinal form. (OY)
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 18 mss, but has unfortunately conflated three separate works that contain masāʾil: K. al-maʿrifa (Carullah 986, Shehit Ali 1341, Carullah 2080, 22b, Fatih 5322, Veliyuddin 1821, Azhar 33595); ʿAqīdat ahl al-ikhtiṣāṣ (3rd profession of faith extract from Fut.I.41–47; Shehit Ali 1342, 145-146b, copied by al-Hamawayh d. 658H; ); a later collection of masāʾil from different authors including IA called K. al-Masāʾil (Esad Ef. 1477, 71-147, Carullah 2120). Maurizio Marconi has analysed all the extant mss and is preparing a critical edition of 54 masāʾil of K. al-Maʿrifa.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

additions
RG. 424 R. fî ma'rifat Allâh et RG. 433 K. al-masâ'il Add Ces deux titres du RG. correspondent très vraisemblablement à un seul et même ouvrage également répertorié sous le titre Al-tanazzulât al-layliyya (RG. 761).

K. Mashāhid al-asrār al-qudsiyya
كتاب مشاهد الأسرار القدسية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
432
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mashahid
Uniform Title
K. Mashāhid al-asrār al-qudsiyya
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

Contemplations of the Holy Mysteries

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
katabtu hādhihi al-risāla ilā aṣhāb al-shaykh al-fāḍil al-ʿārif ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz b. Abū Bakr al-Qurashī al-Mahdawī... al-ḥamdu lillāh rabb al-ʿālamīn ḥamdan aniyyatan lā ḥamdan huwiyyatan
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Seville?
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
590H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
651
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
An early work, written in the Maghreb, but we do not know whether the version we have is the same as the first recension. It consists of 14 contemplations in the style of Niffarī’s Mawāqif. There are two commentaries, one by Ibn Sawdakīn and one by Sitt al-ʿAjam, which have been used in a critical Spanish edition and an English translation of Mashāhid. There are two associated works; a prologue which is classifed by OY as RG 626, and a commentary by Ibn Sawdakīn classified as RG 684.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by three historic mss. The best is probably Manisa 1183 (651H, copied by a direct disciple of IA’s) and Veliyuddin 1782 (929H, copied from an original dated 596H). Some texts include the prologue (RG 626) and an epilogue. We have classified all these under RG 432 as it is too complex to make distinctions. Michel Chodkiewicz has examined both the Manisa ms, and the Paris National ms (B. N. 6104). He finds a slight difference between them in Ibn ʿArabi’s commentary.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
