Mawāqiʿ al-nujūm
مواقع النجوم
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
443
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mawaqi
Uniform Title
Mawāqiʿ al-nujūm
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
Mawāqiʿ al-nujūm wa maṭālī‘ ahillat al-asrār wa-l-ʿulūm
العنوان الكامل
Variants

K. sirr al-asrâr was muntahâ ‘ilm al-abrâr was huwa al-mu-sammâ bi sifr Âdam

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh al-ḥayy al-qayyūm al-muqsim bimawāqiʿ al-nujūm
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Alméria
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
595
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<638
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
According to Fut I. 347, this work was written in 595H, in 11 days during the month of Ramadan. It is dedicated to al-Habashi.
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Written for IA’s close companion, Badr al-Ḥabashī, this is said to be the book that explains what all spiritual masters need to teach. It describes three degrees of surrender (islām), faith (īmān) and true goodness (iḥsān), according to three levels of realisation. It includes a detailed discussion of how all the members and faculties of the human being participate in the Divine Praise.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least four historic mss. The best is Yusuf Ağa 5001, written by SQ in the lifetime of IA, with a samāʿ signed by IA, although it is badly water-damaged, and Majles 594 (652H) which is taken from a copy made in Damascus in 606H. Other mss identified by JC: Bayazid 3466 (735H?)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

مصنفات ذات الصلة

I, 334; II,319, 581, 636; III, 112; IV, 199, 263, 295.

al-Mawʿiẓa al-ḥasana
الموعظة الحسنة
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
448
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mawiza
Uniform Title
al-Mawʿiẓa al-ḥasana
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
Al-Mawʾiz al-ḥasana
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mosul
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
962
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A collection of ḥadīth, especially of sayings of prophetic figures other than Muhammad. Reported in FM 1:3.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists three mss., none of which are historic. There are some aspects which point towards its being by Ibn ‘Arabī. One ms. (Carullah 2070) quotes IA at the end: “I completed it in one day in Mosul,” and a work of this title is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269). But Claude Addas has examined the text as it appears in the printed Cairo edition, and feels that the internal evidence of the text does not permit its attribution to Ibn ‘Arabī. Therefore, in the absence of further evidence, it is classified as unverified. Further mss identified by JC: Manchester, Rylands 106 X (1031H?); Riḍā (=Raza?) library, Rampur (India) 369/1 or SerialNo 3939; AccNo 8314; BookNo 997; ff.29b-41a (990H)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Mīm
كتاب الميم
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
462
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mim
Uniform Title
K. al-Mīm
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Mīm wa-l-wāw wa al-nūn
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh fātiḥ al-ghuyūb wa-shāriḥ al-ṣudūr
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Aleppo
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
617H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
617
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
On the symbolism of the letters mīm, wāw and nūn, and all the letters which make up these names.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 24 mss., of which six can be considered historic. The best are Veliyuddin 1759, which is a holograph with a samāʿ dated 617H in Aleppo, and Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, copied by Ayyūd b. Badr).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

№ 69 (ʿAwwād 1954)

مذكور فيه

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʼil Ibn al-ʿArabī. al-Ṭabʿah 1., الطبعة ١.. Ḥaydarābād al-Dakkan: Maṭbaʿat Dāʼirat al-Maʿārif al-ʿUthmānīyah, 1367.
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʾil Ibn al-ʿArabī (2/3). Edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb. 1. Dimashq: دار نينوى, 2021.
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāīl Ibn al–ʿArabī (1/5). Edited by Saʿīd ʿAbd al-Fattāḥ. London: Al-Intishār al-ʿArabī, 2001.
Translations
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
Y
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018. Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. Not an official critical edition, but the Arabic text produced by Gilis alongside his French translation Le Livre du Mîm, du Wâw et du Nūn (Paris, 2002) is taken from an excellent ms. – Shehit Ali 2813, written by Ayyūb b. Badr and read in front of IA. Another edition has been completed by Pablo Beneito but not yet published.
Translations
French translation by Charles-André Gilis: Le Livre du Mīm, du Wāw et du Nūn, Beirut, 2002.
Studies

Edition in progress (PB)

OY has this as 1892 which is an entirely wrong reference

K. Mishkāt al-anwār fīmā ruwiya ʿan Allāh
كتاب مشكاة الأنوار فيما روي عن الله
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
480
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mishka
Uniform Title
K. Mishkāt al-anwār fīmā ruwiya ʿan Allāh
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. Mishkāt al-anwār fī mā ruyiya ʿan Allāh min akhbār
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabbi al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqibatihi lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ḥawla…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mecca
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
599H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
678
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A collection of 101 ḥadīth made by IA. It consists of three parts; the first with 40 ḥadīth, the second with 40, and the third with 21. See Divine Sayings (Oxford, 2004) for edited text and translation.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 19 mss., of which at least nine can be considered historic, although there are no autographs. The best is Beyazit 817 (in the hand of al-Farghānī, pre-662H), Manisa 2989 (678H, copied from original) and Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667H, copied by a disciple of SQ’s.) The three parts are sometimes separated in the collections.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical Edition established by Hirtenstein and Notcutt and printed alongside their English translation Divine Sayings (Oxford, 2004). This Arabic text is also reproduced in the Urdu translation by Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2013). Ed. Abrar Aḥmad Shāhī.
Translations
English translation by Lex Hixon and Fariha al-Jerrahi: 101 Diamonds, New York, 2002. English translation by Stephen Hirtenstein and Martin Notcutt: Divine Sayings, Oxford, 2004. French translation by Muhammad Valsan: La Niche des Lumieres, Paris, 1993.
Spanish translation by Ferran Grau Ribes: El tabernáculo de las luces : mishkat al anwar. 101 dichos del Profeta, Madrid, 1998.
Studies
Additions

English translation, Divine Sayings, published by Anqa Publishing.

K. al-Muʿashsharāt
كتاب المعشرات
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
484
Alt. RG №
xml:id
muashsharat
Uniform Title
K. al-Muʿashsharāt
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-mu‘ashsharāt al-maymūna
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
unẓur ilā al-ḥaqq madhlūl bi-asmāʾ wa-kawnihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
808
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A series of poems of ten verses each about the letters of the Arabic alphabet. The poems are also in the Dīwān (Bulaq, 855, pp. 218-232).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 14 mss., of which three can be considered historic: Halet 245 (858H, taken from an original written by IA dated 630H with a samāʿ) and University A3320 (808H, taken from the same original with several samāʿ); Topkapi Ahmet 1555 (786H). Other mss: Budeiri 36; Paris 3171/2; Br. Mus. 1527/2; Esc. 417
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

R. al-Mubashshirāt
رسالة المبشرات
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
485
Alt. RG №
xml:id
mubashshirat
Uniform Title
R. al-Mubashshirāt
العنوان الموحد
Full Title

Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabbi al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqibatihi lil-muttaqīn, wa-ṣallā Allāh…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<673
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Descriptions of some of IA’s dreams and visions. One of two places where IA describes his conversion under the guidance of Jesus, Moses and Muhammad (see Claude Addas, Quest for the Red Sulphur, Cambridge, 1993, p.41).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists six mss., of which three can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Ağa 7838, written by SQ (pre-673H).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Muḥāḍarat al-abrār
محاضرة الأبرار
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
493
Alt. RG №
xml:id
muhadarat
Uniform Title
Muḥāḍarat al-abrār
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
Muḥāḍarat al-abrār wa musāmarāt al-akhyār
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

The lectures of the godly and the conversations of the good

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-hamdu lillāh alladhī aṭlaʿa shams al-fawāʾid fī muḥāḍarat al-abrār
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
933
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Using the same format as Sulamī’s book Maqāmāt al-awliyāʾ, a book of adab, with many stories from al-Andalus and people that IA knew.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, of which there are no historic mss, although Ahmad III A2415 is dated 712H. Brocklemann, according to OY, thinks it is apocryphal and should be attributed to Dhahabī (d.748) (see OY p. 397). But there is textual evidence that it is by IA: Claude Addas, in her biography of IA Quest for the Red Sulphur (Cambridge, 1993), refers to several passages where incidents are described which correspond to information in other verified texts; eg. pp. 211, 223, 227. Also, a work of this title is mentioned in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269). Michel Chodkiewicz relates that some years ago he saw an autograph copy, written in Malatya, which is in private ownership in Tunisia, but we have not yet been able to obtain a copy of this. Other mss identified: Ragib Pasha 1204 (944H); Veliyuddin 2573 ff. 1-275 (945H); Düğümlü Baba 392 (950H)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-fākhira
كتاب مختصر الدرة الفاخرة
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
496
Alt. RG №
105
xml:id
mukhtasar-dur
Uniform Title
K. Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-fākhira
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabb al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqaba li-l-muttaqīn...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Autobiographical sketches of IA’s masters in al-Andalus, a companion volume to his Rūḥ al-quds (RG 639). This work was written in Andalusia, and therefore there are no extant manuscripts of the original work. However, Ibn ʿArabī rewrote a version of the text later for a friend in Damascus, and this is the text, entitled K. Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-fākhira, that we now have. Abrar Ahmad adds: Shaykh Ibn Arabi says in the first paragraph of this Mukhtaṣar al-Durra al-Fākhira: سألني بعض من يكرم علي من إخواني بمحروسة دمشق أن أوقفه على كتاب أودعته ذكر بعض من لقيته فانتفعت به في طريق الأخرة فلم يكن عندي حاضرا عند سواله فإني تركته بالمغرب فقيدت له هذا المختصر في ذكر بعض المشيخة؟ من أهل الله المتمكنين في طريق أهل التحقيق من الصالحين العارفين رضي الله عنهم جميعهم مستعينًا بالله تعالى ولم أذكر فيه إلا من لقيته ورأيته وصحبته من رجال ونساء وكبير في السن وصغير على قدر ما تذكرت منهم في هذا الوقت. وذكرت على كل واحد منهم حكاية رأيتها منه من كلام حكمة أو خرق عادة أو موعظة و تركت منهم كثيرا أضعاف ما ذكرت. (مختصر الدرة الفاخرة - الصفحة الأولي للمخطوط)
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There are only two extant mss.: one, Esad Ef. 1777, is listed by OY as Al-durrat al-fākhira (RG 105) and is late (1006H); the other OY lists as RG 496, K. Mukhtaṣar al-durrat al-fākhira in Veliyuddin 1800. OY lists Esad Efendi under both classifications, and Veliyuddin 1800/186-201B, under RG 496 only. We would suggest that they should both be under RG 496. The Veliyuddin ms. is early (715H) and presumably the source for Esad Ef. The main factor in considering this a verified work is the correlation with the well-verified work Rūḥ al-quds (RG 639) and the fact that it relates many of the same incidents.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

K. al-Muqniʿ fī īḍāḥ al-sahl al-mumtaniʿ
كتاب المقنع في إيضاح السهل الممتنع
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
511
Alt. RG №
xml:id
muqni
Uniform Title
K. al-Muqniʿ fī īḍāḥ al-sahl al-mumtaniʿ
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Muqniʿ fi īḍāḥ al-sahl al-mumtanī
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
mimman nasāmā (nasāmī) fa-sammā, wa-kharaja ʿan kulli arḍin wa-samā
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Damascus
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
602H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<638
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Damascus in Jumādā l-ūlā 602H (Vel.51/115a)
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
An alchemical treatise on the esoteric knowledge symbolised by living water.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 16 mss., of which three can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Ağa 7838 (undated, but most probably written in IA’s lifetime). According to OY, the work was written in 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of notes on Veliyuddin 51 and Bayazid 3750. But our investigation of Vel. 51 shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing and in fact, the note says it was written in Damascus in 602H. Bayazid 3750 likewise does not mention Jerusalem, but confirms the date of Jumādā l-ūlā 602H. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyyudin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Jane and Denis (Vel.51): It was written (kutiba) in the city of Damascus in the month of Jumâdâ l-ûlâ of the year 602.

Al-Muwashshaḥāt al-ilāhiyya wa-l-azjāl
الموشحات الإلهية والأزجال
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
517
Alt. RG №
xml:id
muwashshahat
Uniform Title
Al-Muwashshaḥāt al-ilāhiyya wa-l-azjāl
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
hādhā al-wujūd al-ʿām, ʿilmī bihi awlā
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
777
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A collection of 21 poems written in the muwashshaḥ style – a specifically Andalusian form of poetry which was common to the Muslims, Jews and Christians of the region.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There is only one copy of this text, Shehit Ali 1389 (c.777H), which has a note saying it was taken from a copy in the hand of IA. There was also a copy now lost in Yusuf Ağa 5503. A comparison with the muwashshaḥāt in the Bulaq Dīwān reveals that the 21 poems in the ms. are all in the Great Dīwān, although the order in which they are presented is different and there are minor textual variations. It is therefore unclear whether this is an extract from some version of the Dīwān, or an earlier version of a work which was later incorporated into it, so for the time being it is regarded as a stand-alone work.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Naqsh al-Fuṣūṣ
نقش الفصوص
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
528
Alt. RG №
xml:id
naqsh
Uniform Title
Naqsh al-Fuṣūṣ
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
iʿlam an al-asmāʾ al-ilāhiyya al-ḥusnā yaṭlaba bi-dhawātihā wujūd al-ʿālam
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
650
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Commentary on the Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam (RG 150) by IA himself.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists nine mss., verified by one definitive historic ms. and one other: Manisa 1183 (c.650H, from an original in the hand of IA) and the undated Husein Celebi 477. There is some confusion in OY between this and RG 454, Miftaḥ al-Fuṣūṣ. Some have thought that the commentary is actually by Ibn Sawdakīn (see OY p. 407), but the Husein Celebi ms states that it is by the author of the Fuṣūṣ, i.e. IA.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Naṣāʾiḥ
كتاب النصائح
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
532
Alt. RG №
xml:id
nasaih
Uniform Title
K. al-Naṣāʾiḥ
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

R. al-mu¡awwal ¡alayhi

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-wajd al-ḥāṣil ʿan al-tawājud
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
650
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A series of maxims showing “what cannot be relied upon” in the quest for God. It is popularly known by its variant title R. fī mā lā yuʿawwal ʿalayhi (Treatise on what cannot be relied upon).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 14 mss., of which only one can be considered historic: Manisa 1183 (650H, written by a direct disciple of IA). OY claims that Beyazit 3750 was copied from an original but our inspection has failed to confirm this. University A3239 (OY) is actually Iṣṭilāhāt (RG 315).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

Alternate title: R. fī mā lā yuʿawwal ʿalayhi

K. Natāʾij al-adhkār
كتاب نتائج الأذكار
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
536
Alt. RG №
xml:id
nataij
Uniform Title
K. Natāʾij al-adhkār
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabbi al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqibatihi lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ḥawla… Aqūlu dhākiran tāliyan Rabbi ishraḥ lī…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
<631H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
667
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A series of dhikrs (rememorations of God) and their effects for those who are brought close to the divine presence (the muqarribūn) .
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists five mss., none of which can be considered definitive or historic. The British Library OR 9632, however, which OY did not see, was written during Ibn ʿArabī’s lifetime by one of his known students, and is definitive in attributing it to him. OY says that the author quotes an event in 631H which would support the possibility of attribution. In addition, a work of this title is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

№ 189 (ʿAwwād 1954)

Juzʾ yashtamilu ʿalā al-nawādir al-mulṭaqatah min lafẓ al-Shaykh
جزئ يشتمل علي النوادر الملطقتة من لفظ الشيخ
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
(847)
Alt. RG №
xml:id
nawadir
Uniform Title
Juzʾ yashtamilu ʿalā al-nawādir al-mulṭaqatah min lafẓ al-Shaykh
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna aṣṭafā. samʿatu min lafẓ al-shaykh...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
672
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A series of anecdotes about IA and his advice to the Seljuk sultan, written down by SQ. Some of these anecdotes are included in FM. Not catalogued by OY so we have given it a separate RG number.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only one unique manuscript written by SQ himself, which is sufficient support for regarding it as a genuine work. In addition, some of the the text is also found in FM.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Nuqabāʾ
كتاب النقباء
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
548
Alt. RG №
xml:id
nuqaba
Uniform Title
K. al-Nuqabāʾ
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-salām ʿala ʿibādī alladhina iṣṭafa
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
761
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
The nuqabāʾ (sing. naqīb) are a category of 300 saints in the spiritual hierarchy. Defined by IA in his list of Sufi terminology (Iṣṭilāḥāt al-Ṣuƒiyya, RG 315) as those who uncover the hidden aspects of the self (nafs).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists nine mss. of which four can be considered historic. The best are Veliyuddin 51 (c.762H, copied from an original in the hand of IA) and Manisa 1183 (655H, written by a direct disciple of IA’s). Manisa ms gives the names of 12 nuqabāʾ from the time of the Prophet, but these vary in other mss.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

Veliyyudin 51, 75-83b, eao, 762H
JC

MC

AAS

Root

CA

SH

JC

AK

MM

AP

Date: is this OY’s mistaken reading again. See Denis and Jane: The title is given on 75a, and the text begins on 75b. There is a short note at the end saying that it was copied by Ahmad b. M. b. Muthabbit and taken from an original in the hand of Ibn ‘Arabî. Osman Yahia, however, has once again stated that the work was composed in Jerusalem in 602 on the basis of this note,[18] for which we can see no justification.

Nuskhat al-ḥaqq
نسخة الحق
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
551
Alt. RG №
xml:id
nuskha
Uniform Title
Nuskhat al-ḥaqq
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʿala al-insān al-kāmil muʿallim al-malak
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
621
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
621
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Short treatise on the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil) as the microcosm of the universe.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 33 mss., of which at least three can be considered historic. The best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H in Damascus, written by Ayyūb b. Badr and checked by IA) and Berlin 2921 (637H). Other good copies, Murad Bukhari 207 and Veliyuddin 1826, were taken from Ayyūb b. Badr’s copy.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Qasam al-ilāhī bi al-ism al-rabbānī
كتاب القسم الإلهي بالإسم الرباني
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
565
Alt. RG №
xml:id
qasam
Uniform Title
K. al-Qasam al-ilāhī bi al-ism al-rabbānī
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabbi al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqibatihi lil-muttaqīn
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mosul
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
601
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
761
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
29 Jumādā l-ūlā 601H in Mosul (Vel/51/68b)
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on all the Qur’anic passages relating to the name Rabb (Lord), interpreting them in a mystical manner.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 17 mss., of which two can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 51 (c.782H, copied from an original in the hand of IA.) According to OY, it was written 601H in Jerusalem on the basis of a note on Veliyuddin 51, but our investigation shows that he has confused the place of copying with the place of writing. In fact, the note says that IA wrote the original ms. in Mosul in 601H. (See Jane Clark and Denis McAuley Some Notes on the Manuscript Veliyuddin 51, JMIAS 40, 2006.)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

vel.50: … I copied it from the handwriting of its author Ibn ‘Arabî. And he said (may God have mercy on him) at the end of it: “The book was completed in the city of Mosul on the 29th of Jumâdâ al-ûlâ of the year 601. And I found in his handwriting, at the end of it …”

K. al-Quṭb wa-l-imāmayn
كتاب القطب والإمامين
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
585

Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabbi al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqibatihi lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ḥawla…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة

تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
825
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the station of the spiritual ‘pole’ (quṭb) and the two Imams.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 18 mss., of which at least two can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 1826 (c.825H, copied from an original which had been read to IA). Carullah 2080 has a note referring to Chapter 270 of FM, which is on the same subject.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

R. al-Shaykh al-ʿArabī ilā Abī ʿAlī al-Ghazzāl
رسالة الشيخ العربي إلي أبي علي الغزال
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
611
Alt. RG №
533
xml:id
risala-ghaz
Uniform Title
R. al-Shaykh al-ʿArabī ilā Abī ʿAlī al-Ghazzāl
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
li-rabbina al-ʿaẓama wa-l-jalāl wa-l-taqdīs wa-l-ijlāl
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
667
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A short letter to al-Ghazzāl, a disciple of the Andalusian mystic Ibn al-ʿArīf (d. 536/1141 in Marrakesh). The work is also known as R. al-Nashʾatayn (RG 533, as given in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269)). This correspondence was exchanged before the final departure of IA for the East in 598H (see the preface to the text and Rūḥ al-Quds (RG 639) (OY))
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss., of which only one can be considered historic: Veliyuddin 1686 (c.667H, copied by a disciple of SQ’s in Konya). The basis for its status as verified text is the fact that the three poems it contains are all in the Paris Dīwān (BN 2348). This work has a variant title of R. al-Nashʾatayn for which OY has created a separate RG (533), which is listed in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li al-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269). However, we have consolidated the mss. under RG 611, as it is the title which appears most frequently on the mss. themselves.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

R. al-Shaykh ilā al-imām al-Rāzī
رسالة الشيخ إلي الإمام الرازي
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
612
Alt. RG №
xml:id
risala-raz
Uniform Title
R. al-Shaykh ilā al-imām al-Rāzī
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna aṣṭafā wa-ʿalā waliyyi fī Allāh taʿalā Fakhr al-Dīn al-Razī
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
606H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
690
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A letter written to IA’s philosopher contemporary, Fakhr al-Dīn al-Rāzī, calling him to return from the pursuit of intellectual knowledge to spiritual intuition.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, of which there are three early mss. though none are definitive. The best is probably Shehit Ali 1341 (c.725H, a good collection with several works taken from originals in the hand of IA). However, the note at the end of this work says “taken from an original” without specifying its nature, so it is not certain that it was in IA’s hand. The case for regarded this as a verified work rests on the internal evidence of the text. JC has identified other copies: Kastamonu 2183 fols 31a-31b (704H); Köprülü, Fazıl Ahmed Pş., ??, 87-92 s (739H?)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical edition in progress by Muhammed Rustom, who has also published a translation of the full text: Ibn ʿArabī’s Letter to Fakhr al-dīn al-Rāzī: A Study and Translation, Journal of Islamic Studies 25:2 (2014), pp. 113-137 Critical edition, plus a translation into Urdu by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2008). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī.
Translations
English translation by Muhammed Rustom: ‘Ibn ʿArabī’s Letter to Fakhr al-dīn al-Rāzī: A Study and Translation’, Journal of Islamic Studies 25:2 (2014), pp. 113-137. French translation by Michel Valsan: ‘Epître adressée à l'Imâm ar-Rāzî’, in Etudes Traditionnelles, 1961, pp. 242-253.

R. Rūḥ al-quds fī munāṣaḥat al-nafs
رسالة روح القدس في مناصحة النفس
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
639
Alt. RG №
xml:id
ruh
Uniform Title
R. Rūḥ al-quds fī munāṣaḥat al-nafs
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

The Holy Spirit in the Counselling of the Soul

عناوين بديلة
Translations

The Holy Spirit in the Counselling of the Soul

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
min al-ʿabd al-ḍaʿīf al-nāṣiḥ al-shafīq al-maʾmūr bi-l-naṣḥ
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mecca
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
600H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
600
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise originally addressed to Ibn ʿArabī’s friend in Tunis, al-Mahdawī, describing the way in which the soul is educated and advised by the Holy Spirit through the example of previous generations, present-day masters and by direct inspiration. The middle section, describing his early education with over 70 teachers in Spain and North Africa, was translated by R W J Austin in the 1970s and published as Sufis of Andalusia (London, 1971); it has subsequently become one of the best known texts by IA in modern times.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by three historic mss. The best is undoubtedly University A79 which is in the hand of SQ’s father and is the riwāya (transmission) of al-Ḥabashī, dated 600H, with at least nine samāʿs in IA’s lifetime.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
Y
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical Edition, alongside an Urdu translation, published by The Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2012). Ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī.
Translations
There is no complete translation of this work. The following cover only four of its five parts. Partial English translation (middle section) by R W J Austin: Sufis of Andalusia, London, 1971; reprinted Hawick, 2001. Partial English translation (first and last sections) by Roger Boase and Farid Sahnoun: ‘Excerpts from the Epistle on the Spirit of Holiness’ in Muhyiddin Ibn ʿArabī (1165-1240), Ed. Stephen Hirtenstein and Michael Tiernan, Oxford, 1993. Partial French translation by R W J Austin; Gérard Lecomte: Les Soufis d'Andalousie : (Rûh al-quds et ad-Durrat al-fâkhirah), Paris 1979; 1988.
Partial Spanish translations by Miguel Asín Palacios: Vidas de Santones Andaluces, Madrid, 1935. Partial Spanish translation of Part 3 by Miguel Asín Palacios: Risalat al-Quds, Madrid 1939. Partial Spanish translation by R W J Austin, David García Valverde: Los Sufis de Andalucia, Malaga, 1990. Partial German translation by Alma Geise: Ibn ʿArabī: Urwolke und Welt, Munich 2002.
Studies
Additions

The stories are translated by R W J Austin as Sufis of Andalusia. The Ghurab edition is not a critical edition.

Sharḥ Khalʿ al-naʿlayn
شرح خلع النعلين
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
681
Alt. RG №
xml:id
sharh-khal
Uniform Title
Sharḥ Khalʿ al-naʿlayn
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-hamdu lillahī rabb al-ʿālamīn arād al-ḥamd al-muqayyid
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
640
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Commentary on the work of the Andalusian mystic, Abū al-Qāsim b. Qasiy, (d. 546/1151, Marrakesh). He claimed to be the Mahdī, and organised an anti-Almoravid rebellion in the Algarve. IA claims to have met his son in 590H. IA was very critical of his ideas in this work. See Addas Quest for the Red Sulphur, (Cambridge, 1993. pp. 55-7) for more on both the original and the commentary.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists five mss., of which we have investigated four. The work is verified by three historic works: Shehit Ali 1174 (741H, copied from an original riwāya Ibn Sawdakīn), Veliyuddin 1673 (677H) and Yusuf Ağa 7838 (640H from SQ’s library). There is also a work of the same title attributed to ʿAbd Allah Bosnevi (d. 1054/1644) which has caused some confusion.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

K. Shawāhid al-ḥaqq fī al-qalb
كتاب شواهد الحق في القلب
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
689
Alt. RG №
xml:id
shawahid
Uniform Title
K. Shawāhid al-ḥaqq fī al-qalb
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
hādhā kitāb yataḍamman mā taʾtī bihi shawāhid al-ḥaqq fī al-qalb...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Damascus
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
621
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
617
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Maxims, consisting of a number of short conundrums, counsels, instruction, intimations, quotations and allusions. Gerald Elmore (see ‘A Selection of texts on the theme of praise from some gnomic works by Ibn ʿArabī’ in JMIAS 23, pp. 58-85) feels that this text is closely related to K, al-Tarājim (RG 737), which is probably the ‘mother’ text, but further research is needed to ascertain which came first.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 24 mss., of which six can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Ağa 4868, which is an autograph, but the ms. has been stolen and we only have a digitised microfilm copy. The next best is Shehit Ali 2813 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr in Damascus and read back to the author).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Ikhtiṣār al-sīra al-nabawiyya al-Muḥammadiyya
إختصار السيرة النبوية المحمدية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
276
Alt. RG №
xml:id
sira
Uniform Title
Ikhtiṣār al-sīra al-nabawiyya al-Muḥammadiyya
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

Ikhtißår al-siråh sayyidnå rasål Allåh

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā li-hadhā wa-mā kunā li-nahtadī lawlā an hadānā Allāh laqad jaʿat rusul rabbina bi-l-ḥaqq wa-l-ṣalāwāt ʿalā...
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
701
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified B
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Work ascribed to IA on the life and qualities of the Prophet, including the palm-tree miracle in Seville. The text has been analysed by Pablo Beneito (JMIAS 30, 2001).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY cites no surviving mss., but we have inspected an early mss. in Jerusalem (Khalidiyya 967, 701H, of which there is a microfilm copy in the Dār al-kutub, Cairo.) which carries a dedication to IA’s sons and his daughter Fāṭima. This makes it highly likely that it is an authentic work. The work is mentioned in both the lists which IA made of his own works, Fihris muʾallafāt al-shaykh al-akbar (RG142) and Ijāza li-l-malik al-Muẓaffar (RG 269) and internal evidence as presented by Pablo Beneito (see JMIAS 30, 2001) supports the verification. There is some confusion between this work and K. al-Shamāʾil al-nabī, for which OY lists three mss and assigned a separate RG number (669). But our research so far indicates that there is only one work with variant titles. We have therefore consolidated under RG 276 and categorised RG 669 as a duplicate.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

K. al-Tadbīrāt al-ilāhiyya
كتاب التدبيرات الإلهية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
716
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tadbirat
Uniform Title
K. al-Tadbīrāt al-ilāhiyya
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Tadbirat al-ilāhiya fī iṣlāḥ al-mamlaka al-insāniyya
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī istakhraja al-insān min wujūd ʿilmihi
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mawrūr (Andalusia)
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
>595H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<638
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
This is one of IA’s earliest works, written in four days during a visit to his friend al-Mawrūrī in the village of Moron in Andalusia. It was inspired by Sirr al-Asrār (The Secrets of Secrets) by pseudo-Aristotle concerning the nature of government, with IA adding a spiritual dimension to the discussion. In 21 chapters, it explains the correspondences between the external political hierarchy of princes and rulers, and the inner rulership of the spirit within the human being.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least three historic mss. The best is probably Leiden Or 86, written possibly in 606H. Also Corum 756 (part 1) and Yusuf Ağa 4859 (part 2) from SQ’s library, which were originally the same document, undated. Yusuf Aga 4859 was stolen but a copy exists on digitised microfilm. Koprulu 713 seems to be a complete copy of this original dated 663H. OY also lists four commentaries, including one by al-Dāmūnī (d. 1199/1785).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāīl Ibn al–ʿArabī (2/5). Edited by Saʿīd ʿAbd al-Fattāḥ. London: Al-Intishār al-ʿArabī, 2002.
Translations
تراجم
Asín Palacios, Miguel. El Islam cristianizado: estudio del "sufismo" a través de las obras de Abenarabi de Murcia. 1. ed. Madrid: Editorial Plutarco, 1931.
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. ‘Conseil à l’aspirant (22ème chapitre de l’ouvrage At-tadbîrâtu-l-ilâhiyya fî-islâhi-l-mamlakati-l-insâniyya)’. Translated by Michel Vâlsan. Études Traditionnelles Mars-Avr. ; n° 370 et Mai-Juin ; n° 371 (1962): 85 (= p. 37 dans le cahier de Mars-Avril 1962) et 122.
Studies
أبحاث
Asín Palacios, Miguel. El Islam cristianizado: estudio del "sufismo" a través de las obras de Abenarabi de Murcia. 1. ed. Madrid: Editorial Plutarco, 1931.
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
Y
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
An edition established by H S Nyberg in Kleinere Schriften des Ibn al-ʿArabî, (Leiden, 1919). A recent critical edition, plus an Urdu translation, published by The Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan, 2014), edited by Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī. This is based upon the best early manuscripts as found in the MIAS archive, including Yusuf Ağa 4859 and Koprulu 713, but not the autograph Leiden Or 86, which had not yet been identified when the text was edited.
Translations
English translation by Shaykh Tosun Bayrak: Divine Governance of the Human Kingdom, plus ‘What the seeker needs’ and ‘Treatise on Unity’, Louisville, 1997.
Spanish translation by Tosun Bayrak al-Jerrahi al-Halveti, Afife Traverso and Emilio Alzueta: El divino gobierno del reino humano, Lo que necesita el buscador tratador sobre el uno y único, Granada, 2004.
Studies
Additions

A very interpretative translation exists by Tosun Bayrak called ‘Divine Governance of the Human Kingdom’
Asin Palacios, in El. Isl, Crist, pp352-370
corrections
additions
msAdditions
Yusuf Aga 4859,79-96, incomplete, autograph

Faṣl mufīd fī tafsīr Fātiḥat al-Kitāb
فصل مفيد في تفسير فاتحة الكتاب
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
132
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tafsir-fat
Uniform Title
Faṣl mufīd fī tafsīr Fātiḥat al-Kitāb
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
summayt fātiḥat al-kitāb…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
630
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Extract from an exegesis on the Fātiḥa, why it is called the opening, etc. The original source is not known, but our researches show that it is a precious copy of a text also found on 1a of Evkaf Muzesi 1933, the copy of Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam in SQ’s handwriting, which is now not fully readable.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
There is only one ms. listed in OY (he also erroneously classifies it under RG 684). We have found another ms., Halet 809, which is identical (NB: OY also lists this as RG 731). The Shehit Ali text mentions “our shaykh Abū Madyan saying that he never saw a thing except that there was the letter bāʾ over it”, which makes this a bona fide ms.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

al-Juzʾ al-awwal min tafsīr kalām Allāh taʿālā
الجزء الأول من تفسير كلام الله تعالى
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
188.1
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tafsir-kal
Uniform Title
al-Juzʾ al-awwal min tafsīr kalām Allāh taʿālā
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
977
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
An exposition on the Fātiḥa, the first sura of the Qurʿan, and part of the second, Surat al-Baqara. At the end, it is said that this is not the ‘great tafsīr’ of the Shaykh (see RG 172).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only one ms., Shehit Ali 2717 (977H), with a note saying it was taken from a copy made in 875H by Ibn ʿAzm, who copied an original recited by al-Qunawi to the author. Not the same as Dugumlu 9.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

al-Tāʾiyya
التائية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
757
Alt. RG №
xml:id
taiyya
Uniform Title
al-Tāʾiyya
العنوان الموحد

Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
tanazzahta lammā an ḥallalta bi-ḥaḍratī / wa-waḥḥadta fī dhāka l-maqāmi bi-nāẓrati
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
876
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Long poem with the end rhyme in tāʾ, with commentary by Bosnevi.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists four mss., of which none are historic. All texts are relatively late and without special provenance, so it must be considered unverified. Ryad Atlagh is convinced that it is authentic and has presented his arguments in a paper The Phenomenology of the Perfect Man in The Tāʾiyya of Ibn ʿArabī (unpublished, MIAS Symposium, Oxford 1998). All copies we have seen are attributed to IA (varying in length but at least 400 verses). A line-by-line commentary by Abdullah Bosnevi entitled Qurrat ʿayn al-shuhūd also testifies to its authorship by IA. In light of the importance given by Bosnevi to this poem, it is most likely that the original Tāʾiyya should be considered as an authentic work. Critical edition by Yusuf ‘Awda (Cairo, 2015)
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. Tāj al-rasāʾil
كتاب تاج الرسائل
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
736
Alt. RG №
xml:id
taj-ras
Uniform Title
K. Tāj al-rasāʾil
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. Tāj al-rasāʾil wa minhaj al-wasāʾil
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
hadhā kitāb tāj al-rasāʾil wa-minhāj al-wasāʾil
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mecca
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
600
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
600
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Autograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A series of eight love-letters to the Kaʿba, composed after a visionary experience there in 600H.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 20 mss., of which one can be considered definitively historic: Veliyuddin 1759, 600H, al-Ḥabashī’s certified copy, with three samāʿ. According to both OY and Stephen Hirtenstein, it is an autograph.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

الفهرست

№ 51 (ʿAwwād 1954)

الفتوحات

Ref

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāʾil Ibn al-ʿArabī (2/3). Edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb. 1. Dimashq: دار نينوى, 2021.
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāīl Ibn al–ʿArabī (2/5). Edited by Saʿīd ʿAbd al-Fattāḥ. London: Al-Intishār al-ʿArabī, 2002.
Translations
تراجم
Studies
أبحاث
MIAS Records
سجلات مكتبية
In Archive
y
In Library
Y
Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical Edition in progress by Denis Gril. Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
Translations
A partial translation and article by Denis Gril in ‘Love Letters to the Kaʾba; a presentation of Ibn ʿArabī’s Tāj al-Rasāʾil’, JMIAS 17, 1995, pp. 41-54.
Studies
Additions
Add Sur les circonstances de la rédaction de cet ouvrage, voir Addas, Ibn Arabî ou la quête du Soufre rouge, p.253-254 (Quest for the Red Sulphur, pp. 211-213). Cor Il ne s'agit pas d'un recueil de sept épîtres comme l'indique O. Y., mais de huit épîtres. O.Y. mentionne en fait comme une seule épître (Lettre divine sacro-sainte) deux épîtres distinctes (Risâla ilâhiyya/Risâla qudsiyya). La troisième lettre de sa liste-la quatrième en fait-est intitulée par lui "lettre seigneuriale". Or le titre arabe, tel qu'il figure dans le ms. autographe, n'est pas risâla rabbâniyya comme cette traduction le donnerait à penser mais Risâla suryâniyya (autre lecture possible : Risâla sarayâniyya, hypothèse qui serait à mettre en relation avec la formulation sarayân al-ma'bûd fî l-wujûd qui apparaît à la fin de l'ouvrage, f. 144a du ms autographe). O.Y. a sans doute retenu le nombre sept parce qu'il correspond manifestement à celui des tournées rituelles autour de la Ka'ba. Ce symbolisme semble remis en question par l'existence de huit épîtres ; or une phrase de la quatrième lettre montre qu'il n'en est rien : elle rappelle en effet qu'au terme des sept tournées le rite du tawâf doit se clore par un huitième acte-l'accomplissement d'une prière de 2 rak'at devant le maqâm ibrâhîm. S'il est donc en parfaite cohérence avec les gestes successifs prescrits au pèlerin lorsqu'il arrive devant la Ka'ba, le nombre huit trouve son explication la plus profonde dans la nature des termes, chaque fois différent, par lesquels Ibn Arabî se désigne lui-même au début de chaque épître : il se présente d'abord comme 'Abd Allâh puis comme 'Abd al-Hayy, 'Abd al-'Alîm, 'Abd al-Shakûr, 'Abd al-Basîr, 'Abd al-Samî', 'Abd al-Wadûd et enfin 'Abd al-Qâdir. Ces huit dénominations correspondent de toute évidence au Nom de l'Essence (Allâh) puis aux sept attributs qui se manifestent à lui dans sa contemplation du Bayt Allâh et définissent chacun un aspect particulier de sa 'ubûdiyya. (MC)
Critical edition and French translation in progress by Denis Gril.

corrections
additions
Add Sur les circonstances de la rédaction de cet ouvrage, voir Addas, Ibn Arabî ou la quête du Soufre rouge, p.253-254 (Quest for the Red Sulphur, pp. 211-213). Cor Il ne s'agit pas d'un recueil de sept épîtres comme l'indique O. Y., mais de huit épîtres. O.Y. mentionne en fait comme une seule épître (Lettre divine sacro-sainte) deux épîtres distinctes (Risâla ilâhiyya/Risâla qudsiyya). La troisième lettre de sa liste-la quatrième en fait-est intitulée par lui "lettre seigneuriale". Or le titre arabe, tel qu'il figure dans le ms. autographe, n'est pas risâla rabbâniyya comme cette traduction le donnerait à penser mais Risâla suryâniyya (autre lecture possible : Risâla sarayâniyya, hypothèse qui serait à mettre en relation avec la formulation sarayân al-ma'bûd fî l-wujûd qui apparaît à la fin de l'ouvrage, f. 144a du ms autographe). O.Y. a sans doute retenu le nombre sept parce qu'il correspond manifestement à celui des tournées rituelles autour de la Ka'ba. Ce symbolisme semble remis en question par l'existence de huit épîtres ; or une phrase de la quatrième lettre montre qu'il n'en est rien : elle rappelle en effet qu'au terme des sept tournées le rite du tawâf doit se clore par un huitième acte-l'accomplissement d'une prière de 2 rak'at devant le maqâm ibrâhîm. S'il est donc en parfaite cohérence avec les gestes successifs prescrits au pèlerin lorsqu'il arrive devant la Ka'ba, le nombre huit trouve son explication la plus profonde dans la nature des termes, chaque fois différent, par lesquels Ibn Arabî se désigne lui-même au début de chaque épître : il se présente d'abord comme 'Abd Allâh puis comme 'Abd al-Hayy, 'Abd al-'Alîm, 'Abd al-Shakûr, 'Abd al-Basîr, 'Abd al-Samî', 'Abd al-Wadûd et enfin 'Abd al-Qâdir. Ces huit dénominations correspondent de toute évidence au Nom de l'Essence (Allâh) puis aux sept attributs qui se manifestent à lui dans sa contemplation du Bayt Allâh et définissent chacun un aspect particulier de sa 'ubûdiyya.

K. Tāj al-tarājim
كتاب تاج التراجم
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
737
Alt. RG №
xml:id
taj-tar
Uniform Title
K. Tāj al-tarājim
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh rabbi al-ʿālamīn wa-l-ʿāqibatihi lil-muttaqīn, wa-lā ḥawla…
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
617
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Maxims, consisting of a number of short conundrums, counsels, instruction, intimations, quotations and allusions. Gerald Elmore (see ‘A Selection of texts on the theme of praise from some gnomic works by Ibn ʿArabī’ in JMIAS 23, pp. 58-85) feels that this text is closely related to K. al-Shawāhid (RG 689), but further research is needed to ascertain which came first. See Chodkiewicz, Ocean, 90–94.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 23 mss., of which four can be considered historic. The best is a holograph, Yusuf Ağa 4868 (ms. stolen, so only a digitised microfilm is now available). Ayasofia 4817 is dated 649H in Konya and was possibly read before SQ.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Tajalliyāt
كتاب التجليات
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
738
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tajalliyat
Uniform Title
K. al-Tajalliyāt
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh muḥkim al-ʿaql al-rāsikh fī ʿālam al-barāzikh
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Aleppo
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
606
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
620
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Descriptions of 109 theophanies or ‘unveilings’, including IA’s encounters and conversations in the intermediary world (barzakh) with his predecessors, such as Sahl al-Tustārī, Dhū al-Nūn, Junayd etc., which illustrate themes such as unification, perfection, generosity and compassion.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, verified by at least five historical mss. The best is Veliyuddin 1759 (620H, holograph, with a samāʿ in Damascus in the house of IA). The earliest copy is held in Awqāf Baghdad 36175 (OY: 4827), dated 606H, and transcribed into a modern edition by ʿAlī Daḥrūj
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

Criical Edition published by Osman Yahia alongside Ibn Sawdakīn’s commentary Kashf al-Ghayāt (Tehran, 1988). Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, based on mss. from the MIAS archive. Published by al-Qudus, Cairo, 2018.
Translations
French translation by Stéphane Ruspoli: Le Livre des Théophanies d’Ibn ʿArabī, Paris, 2000.
Studies
Additions

Takhmīs qaṣīdat Abī Madyan
تخميس قصيدة أبي مدين
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
748
Alt. RG №
xml:id
takhmis
Uniform Title
Takhmīs qaṣīdat Abī Madyan
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
yā ṭālib min ladhādhāt al-dunā wa-ṭarā
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
>1000
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Strophic poem consisting of 5-line stanzas – a poetic expansion of verses by Abū Madyan. See translation and study by Gerald Elmore: ‘Ibn al-ʿArabī’s ‘Cinquain’ (Takhmīs) on a poem by Abū Madyan’ in Arabica Vol. 46, 1998, pp. 63-96.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only three mss. listed by OY. We have looked at two of them, both late copies with no historical evidence to support attribution to IA. The content, however, strongly favours the attribution. See translation and study by Gerald Elmore in Arabica Vol. 46, 1998, pp. 63-96. Further work needed.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya
كتاب التنزلات الموصلية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
762
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tanazzulat
Uniform Title
K. al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
K. al-Tanazzulât al-mawsiliyya fi asrâr al-tahârât wa al-salawât wa-l-ayyâm al-asliyya:
العنوان الكامل
Variants

Tanazzul al-imlâk li-l-amlâk fi harakât al-aflâk: K. tanazzul al-imlâk min ‘âlam al-arwâh wa-l aflâk.

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waṣafa al-insān bi-mā waṣafa bihi nafsahu
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mosul
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
601H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
620
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Work composed in Mosul in 601H, on the esoteric significance of ablution and prayers, describing how each phase of everyday ritual is imbued with meaning. Consists of 55 chapters.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 31 mss., and it is verified by at least nine historic mss. The best is a holograph, Murad Bukhari 162 (with a samāʿ dated 620H and a note verifying that it was written by IA), Murad Molla 1257 (621H, written by Ayyūb b. Badr) and Yusuf Ağa 4861 (written by SQ).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works
مصنفات ذات الصلة

al-Ijāza

№ 55 (Badawī 1955)
al-Fihrist
الفهرست
Ref
№ 53 (ʿAwwād 1954)
al-Futūḥāt
الفتوحات
Ref (OY)
Ref

Other
مصنفات أخرى
References (in this work)
مذكور فيه
Ref

Publications
منشورات
Editions
طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. al-Tanazzulāt al-Mawṣiliyya fī asrār al-ṭahārāt wa-l-ṣalāt wa-l-ayyām al-aṣliyya. Edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb. al-Qāhirah: Shirkat al-Quds li-l-Nashr wa-l-Tawzīʿ, 2017.

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical Edition has been done by Kerim Lahan but as yet unpublished as far as we know. Critical edition by the Ibn ʿArabī Foundation (Rawalpindi, Pakistan), ed. Abrār Aḥmad Shāhī, , but not yet published Critical edition by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz al-Manṣūb, (Cairo 2016) based on mss. from the MIAS archive.
Translations

Studies
Additions
Add Une première édition a été publiée au Caire en 1961 par Ahmad Zakî 'Atiya et 'Abd al-Bâqî Surûr sous le titre Latâ'if al-asrâr. Une deuxième édition a été publiée au Caire également, en 1986, par le shaykh 'Abd al-Rahmân Hasan Mahmûd sous le titre Tanazzulât mawsiliyya . Ni l'une ni l'autre (basées sur des mss. égyptiens) ne répond aux critères d'une édition scientifique. Une édition critique, établie en vue du Ph.D. à Cambridge en 1996, doit paraître prochainement à Beyrouth. Elle est due à Karîm Lahhâm, qui a recensé 35 mss. (O.Y. en recensait 30 mais, par suite de doubles emplois, sa liste se ramenait en fait à 27 mss.)L'édition à venir de Karîm Lahhâm est basée principalement sur le ms. autographe (Murâd Bukhari 162) et celui transcrit par Qûnâwî (Yusûf Aga 4861) mais note aussi les variantes relevées dans huit autres mss. Elle comporte 55 chapitres (et non 53 comme indiquée par O.Y.). L'introduction met en évidence la complémentarité entre le thème de la descente, développée dans les 45 premiers chapitres, et celui de l'ascension (mi'râj) qui caractérise les 10 derniers chapitres. (MC)
A critical edition and translation has been done by Kerim Lahham as a PhD thesis, unpublished.

corrections
additions
RG 762 Tanazzulât mawsiliyya Add Une première édition a été publiée au Caire en 1961 par Ahmad Zakî 'Atiya et 'Abd al-Bâqî Surûr sous le titre Latâ'if al-asrâr. Une deuxième édition a été publiée au Caire également, en 1986, par le shaykh 'Abd al-Rahmân Hasan Mahmûd sous le titre Tanazzulât mawsiliyya . Ni l'une ni l'autre (basées sur des mss. égyptiens) ne répond aux critères d'une édition scientifique. Une édition critique, établie en vue du Ph.D. à Cambridge en 1996, doit paraître prochainement à Beyrouth. Elle est due à Karîm Lahhâm, qui a recensé 35 mss. (O.Y. en recensait 30 mais, par suite de doubles emplois, sa liste se ramenait en fait à 27 mss.)L'édition à venir de Karîm Lahhâm est basée principalement sur le ms. autographe (Murâd Bukhari 162) et celui transcrit par Qûnâwî (Yusûf Aga 4861) mais note aussi les variantes relevées dans huit autres mss. Elle comporte 55 chapitres (et non 53 comme indiquée par O.Y.). L'introduction met en évidence la complémentarité entre le thème de la descente, développée dans les 45 premiers chapitres, et celui de l'ascension (mi'râj) qui caractérise les 10 derniers chapitres.
msAdditions
Murad Bukhari 162 which carries a sama‘ of 620H, approved, read and written by IA

Taqsīm al-nuʿūt al-ilāhiyya
تقسيم النعوت الإلهية

766

تاريخ الكتابة

نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Treatise on the Real Being.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
Only one ms. of this work, Murad Bukhari 207/1-15. OY says that it is copied from an original, but we have inspected the text and find that the only support for this is a note on the fihris which may or may not cover all the works. Identical to K. al-Ḥaqq (RG 219) (SH).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Tarjumān al-ashwāq
ترجمان الأشواق
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
767
Alt. RG №
xml:id
tarjuman
Uniform Title
Tarjumān al-ashwāq
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
Al-ḥamdu lillāh al-ḥusn al-faʿʿāl al-jamīl alladhī yuhibb al-jamāl… layta shiʿrī hal darū ayyā qalbin malakū
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Mecca
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
611
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<800
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
61 mystical love poems to the Divine Beauty, in the qaṣīda form of pre-Islamic poetry. According to Pablo Beneito (Qurrat al-ʿAyn, 2020), the original collection was 60 odes, to which were added first one then two poems in the preface. It was composed in 611H in Mecca, although the inspiration came in 604H in the meeting with Qurrat al-ʿAyn.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
A much copied work, both on its own and with the commentary (RG116). There are no definitive historic mss. to verify the text in its own right, but there are several for the commentary, which includes the text of the poems. The best copies are therefore contained within mss. of Dhakhāʾir . The best stand-alone mss. are Manisa 6596 (undated, taken from SQ’s copy), and Ragib Pasha 1453 (although very late, probably also taken from SQ’s copy). There is an issue with the preface on this work. There are two basic variants; some mss carry the same preface as the commentary, Dhakhāʾir al-alāq (RG 116. Others have a longer version which begin with a khutba and IA’s account of meeting the young girl, Niẓam, who inspired the poems in Mecca. The situation is complex, with several other variants appearing in some mss (see Jane Clark Mystical Perception and Beauty: Ibn ʿArabī’s Preface to Tarjumān al-Ashwāq in JMIAS 55, 2013).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.
Related Works

تراجم

Studies
أبحاث

y
In Library

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical Edition published by R A Nicholson and published alongside his English translation The Tarjumān al-ashwāq (London, 1911). However, the manuscripts he used were all late and had no special provenance.
Translations
Full English translation of the poems, but not the commentary, by R A Nicholson: The Tarjumān al-ashwāq, London, 1911. Full English translation by Michael Sells: The Translator of Desires, Princeton, 2021. Partial English translation by Michael Sells: Stations of Desire, Jerusalem, 2000. Translation of the Preface by Jane Clark available on http://www.ibnarabisociety.org/articlespdf/preface-tarjuman-al-ashwaq.pdf French translation of poems and commentary by Maurice Gloton, L’interprète des désirs, Paris, 1996. Partial French translation by Mahmoud Sami-Ali: Le chant de l'ardent désir, Arles 2006. Italian translation by Roberto Rossi Testa, L’interprete delle passioni, Milano, 2008
Spanish translation by Carlos Varona Narvión: El intérprete de los deseos, Murcia, 2002. Partial German translation by Alma Geise: Ibn ʿArabī: Urwolke und Welt, Munich 2002.
Studies
Additions

ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz
عقلة المستوفز
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
802
Alt. RG №
xml:id
uqla
Uniform Title
ʿUqlat al-mustawfiz
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī iftataḥa wujūd al-siwā bi-l-arwāh al-muhayyamiyya al-makhlūqa
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
<638
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Holograph
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
The perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil) and the multiple degrees of Being from the most elevated orders of the Archangels to inorganic nature (OY).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
An often copied work, verified by three historic mss. The best is Yusuf Ağa 4690 (undated and incomplete, but in IA’s handwriting); also Shehit Ali 1341 (725H, said to have been taken from an original, which may have been by IA) and Ayasofya 4875 (dated 753H).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Waṣiyya
كتاب الوصية
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
820
Alt. RG №
817
xml:id
wasiyya
Uniform Title
K. al-Waṣiyya
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
ya waladī awṣika bi-taqwā allāh
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists only one ms., Ayasofia 376 (997H), on which the Hyderabad 1948 Rasāʾil Ibn ʿArabi is based. Julian Cook argues that this is a distinct work from RG 821 (of which RG 817 is a duplicate). He has identified that within the text there are three poems (pp. 2, 5 and 7), each of which is also found in ch. 560 of Futuhat – also known as RG 818 Waṣāyā (or even Waṣiyya). So it could well be this work is in fact a set of extracts from there. Further investigation required.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

Waṣiyya fī kayfiyyat ḥuṣūl al-maʿrifa al-quṣwā
وصية في كيفية حصول المعرفة القصوى
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
821
Alt. RG №
xml:id
wasiyya-kayf
Uniform Title
Waṣiyya fī kayfiyyat ḥuṣūl al-maʿrifa al-quṣwā
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
alladhī awṣika bihi ayyuhā al-akh
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
777
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Probable IA
درجة الصحة
Authentication
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
According to OY, deals with intuitive knowledge and how this can be obtained.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 6 mss., none of which can be considered historic. Carullah 2080 (c791H in Konya) is listed by OY as being copied from an original but we could find no specific note to this effect on the text. There are a number of works with similar titles, and there is much work to be done in distinguishing them from one another. However, there is a definite unique work listed here under RG 821, with at least four mss. (Carullah 2070, Husein Celebi 448, Milli 489 and Shehit Ali 1344) being versions of the same text. N.B. OY also lists Shehit Ali 1344 under RG 817.
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

R. fī al-Waʿẓ li-baʿḍ aḥbābihi
رسالة في الوعظ لبعض أحبابه
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه

826
Alt. RG №

Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-salām ʿalā ʿibādihi alladhīna aṣṭafa wa-ʿalā al-akh al-mawlā al-akram
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
مكان الكتابة

624H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
1005
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
A short note of advice to one of his close friends on the beneficial effects of remembrance (dhikr).
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists five mss., of which one can be considered historic: Hamidiye 188 (c.1005H taken from an original dated 624H).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

K. al-Yaqīn
كتاب اليقين
Title & Identification
تسمية المصنف وتعريفه
RG №
834
Alt. RG №
xml:id
yaqin
Uniform Title
K. al-Yaqīn
العنوان الموحد
Full Title
العنوان الكامل
Variants

عناوين بديلة
Translations

عناوين مترجمة
Incipit
al-ḥamdu lillāh alladhī arā Ibrāhīm malakūt al-samāʾ wa-l-arḍ
الكلمة الافتتاحية
Explicit
الكلمة النهائية
Authorship & Authenticity
تأليف المصنف ونسبته
Author
Ibn al-ʿArabī
المؤلف
Place
Hebron
مكان الكتابة
Date
CE
602H
تاريخ الكتابة
Earliest MS
825
الشاهد الأقدم
TPQ-TAQ
– AH
نطاق زمني
Verification
Verified A
درجة الصحة
Authentication
Copy
التوثيق
Other Relations
نسب أخرى
Description
الوصف
On the intuitive knowledge which leads to certitude. Written in Palestine in the Mosque of Yaqīn (see Veliyuddin 1826). Shehit Ali 1341 also has a note about its composition in 602H, stating that it was written in one day on Wednesday 14th Shawwāl 602H on the way to visit the tombs of Lot and Abraham.
Manuscripts
مخطوطات
OY lists 27 mss., of which at least two can be considered historic. The best is Veliyuddin 1826 (c.825H, copied from an original by Ayyūb b. Badr and read before IA in 621H).
Note: once the manuscript data has been migrated, it will be linked to the relevant works in the new system.

2:205. and 2:204-206.

مذكور فيه

Publications
منشورات

طبعات
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. ‘EDIZIONE: IL LIBRO DELLA CERTEZZA (KITĀB AL-YAQĪN) DI IBN ʿARABĪ’. Edited by Maurizio Marconi. El Azufre Rojo 7 (2020).
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. Rasāīl Ibn al–ʿArabī (4/5). Edited by Saʿīd ʿAbd al-Fattāḥ. London: Al-Intishār al-ʿArabī, 2004.
Translations
تراجم
Ibn al-ʿArabī, Muḥyī al-Dīn Muḥammad b. ʿAlī. ‘TRADUZIONE: IL LIBRO DELLA CERTEZZA (KITĀB AL-YAQĪN) DI IBN ʿARABĪ’. Translated by Maurizio Marconi. El Azufre Rojo 7 (2020).
Studies
أبحاث
Marconi, Maurizio. ‘IL LIBRO DELLA CERTEZZA (KITĀB AL-YAQĪN) DI IBN ʿARABĪ. Edizione, traduzione e note a cura di Maurizio Marconi’. El Azufre Rojo 7 (2020).
Marconi, Maurizio. ‘ESEMPI DI PAGINE DEI MANOSCRITTI UTILIZZATI’. El Azufre Rojo 7 (2020).
MIAS Records

Additions, Comments and Corrections
إضافات وتعليق وتدقيق
Editions
Critical edition (based upon early manuscripts from MIAS archive) by Maurizio Marconi, alongside an Italian translation. Azufre Rojo vol. 7 (2020) Critical edition in progress by Michael Ebstein, Martin Buber fellow at Hebrew University of Jerusalem. Completion expected Autumn 2014.
